SVNHdLrrZvhjQRcQnKag_g.text: We got here aroun 10am starving . This is a late breakfast for us.  Noticed that the line was out the door.  I was ready to turn around and leave, but I  am so glad we stayed. Your in line for about 5 minutes then you get to place your order. Nice menu with lots of choices. You can add or change what you want which is a plus (bagel instead of toast). The food came about 10 minutes later and OMG it was wondrful.!!!!!!!. Let's start with the coffee, best I  have had in a long time.  My apple chicken sausage scramble melted in my mouth.  My husband's omlett was so perfect .would we go back. How about tomorrow

I had the chicken sausage scramble and it was excellent. Large portion and cooked perfectly. Everything seemed fresh. Sat outside and enjoyed the perfect late April weather. I recommend all their bagels and omelettes as well ...good service and great place for a family breakfast ...inside and outside seating available with ample parking :)

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Amazing omelets

LYEyJFi2cQ2GQvyk_ceL7Q.text: Pretty sweet place for breakfast or brunch, operates in fairly efficient manner, with lots of bagel types, spread types and sandwiches to choose from. They also double as a coffee shop, have patio seating that's great during this lovely fall AZ weather, and their staff is friendly, patient and knowledgeable about their items.  I ordered a toasted everything bagel with jalepeno cream cheese and a chai latte (sm) for a little over $5. I decided to try lox and they added that on for $2 (a 2oz ramekin). My friend and I sat outside on the patio, which was full, and we ended up stuffed in a corner.  Our bagels came out quickly, within 3-4 minutes, but our drinks took much longer. Both of us were already halfway through our breakfast before our chai lattes were brought to our table.  Quality of food matched the price, bagels were good (if not just a little cold), jalepeno cream cheese was SPICY and the lox was... mehhh I don't know if I'd get it again. My friend had a bagel sandwich and he seemed to enjoy that too.  I'd see myself stopping in here pre-IKEA day-long shopping adventure, but I'd like to see the drinks come out at the same time or even before the food.

ovRFDS3ZJr3fO4R6T4e92w.text: Not bad. I went with Dr Sarah for brunch one Sunday and had a build your own frittata and a bagel. It's hardly phenomenal but it's a good option for brunch.

ipPh2KpoobL78rOjSc-iNQ.text: I went to The Nosh for a cup of coffee and something sweet, to my surprise they had a full menu for sweets and breakfast sandwiches as well. I got the nutella & banana crepes and they were to die for! The best crepes I've had in years! I definitely recommend this place and their coffee was bomb!

9NMcD0GByC3sB8iPwd4eHw.text: This is my favorite place to get a bagel sandwich! They have amazing prices for the portion sizes! Their pancakes are delicious as well, and are served with almond butter!

n948bULisCjO9TMIh6f9yQ.text: Have to post this updated review to express our real disappointment in two aspects of our Nosh experiences.  First, repeatedly, time after time, the decaf coffee is either empty, almost empty, cold, or cold AND almost empty.  Secondly, today we discovered that if you order a piece of toast all by itself, you get charged $2.75. So, $1.09 for a bagel, but $2.75 for a measily piece a toast. What a ripoff.  Come on guys, step it up. Both of these criticisms need to be taken seriously.

mtkWQyoLPZjhUid2l-ZcZg.text: A friend and I stopped by Bagel Nosh on a late Thursday morning to grab some quick coffee and a bagel. As we waited to order, the middle-aged woman donning a hat at the register proceeded to complain to the customers in front of us about how busy it was, comparing the business to that of a Saturday, and whining, "I don't work on Saturdays!" Her attitude continued to prove unpleasant and unwelcoming. Although there aren't many breakfast joints in the area, the mediocre bagels and coffee are not worth the poor customer service.

TM11NI2K7DLas-h9AzOLEw.text: Went here for breakfast and ordered the "Two x Four" which came with toast, hash browns, two eggs, and a meat of your choice (ham, bacon, or sausage). It was excellent. The bacon was thick cut (but still crunchy) and had a smoky flavor. The price was very reasonable at $8 for such a large portion. I would love to go back to try their lunch menu. This is the perfect little cafe spot if you are a fan of bagels, sandwiches, and breakfast food in general. Highly recommend.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Two x Four with eggs (over easy) and bacon. Large portions and great price!

49-aFqLwsboGFhkw2qi7aw.text: We were passing through on a road trip and decided to try out this place. SO glad that we did! I had the "Not So Common" to go, which consisted of eggs, hash browns, biscuits and homemade sausage gravy. You could literally taste the butter in every bite! vg1F6kQm9bzivxygMI7iJA.text: I was in the mood for pancakes so I decided to stop in. This is a bagel shop but the great thing is you can get a full breakfast.   I ordered the pancakes and potatoes (see pictures). The pancakes were really good. They taste like a higher quality McDonald's pancakes. The potatoes were fresh and hot and the did not skimp on the portions.   You can purchase a single pancake if you'd like, so keep in mind they are huge. Make sure you ask for an extra syrup as well.  All and all this is a nice place for breakfast and I'll certainly go back.

You will love their options of deli sandwiches (hot & cold), wraps, & salads! Give the southwest sandwich a try and it will define a new meaning to your lunch time. MmM4m12vYMiB_UsZzAI-GQ.text: Basis for my starred ratings (which skews heavily to the food or drink): 1 star:  Never again. 2 stars:  Poor food, poor experience, extraordinary measures in order for me to come back. 3 stars:  Average, nothing really special, nothing particularly bad. 4 stars:  Very good, would definitely return. 5 stars:  A favorite, one of the best.  The food here is barely above 3 stars, more like 3.5.  I've rated this place a 4 for reasons I'll list a little later.  I like independent breakfast joints.  They usually have something special or different that the big chains lack.  Like I said, the food here is generally 3.5-level.  There are a lot of microwaves here. But it bumps up to a 4 for a the following:  the bacon here is thick and good, the coffee was also solid, they have hash browns that are served crispy, and they have the "Not So Common" - a plate with 2 eggs, hashbrowns, and an order of biscuits and gravy.  I've never seen this combo at any other place as a plate, and it's $8.  It's almost all my favorite breakfast foods on a single plate, and this alone almost warrants the bump to 4 stars.  The pancakes here are average.  The hashbrowns taste average.  The biscuit was ok.  Ordered a plain bagel, untoasted, with cream cheese.  Can't even compare this thing to NYC or Montreal or some other bagel joints - it was not that good.  BUT, all those things listed above, bring up the rating.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Very friendly staff, mellow atmosphere and pretty good food

UNCyFO_V6AUKi0nuJF2GAw.text: Great breakfast and lunch joint.   The apple smoked chicken sausage scramble and the sausage, mushroom and tomato scramble are two of my faves. After one bite, it's hard to go back to having plain old oatmeal or sucky cereal at home. Unless it's Cap'n Crunch of course.   There's other tasty options here including fresh bagels, scratch made buttermilk pancakes with pecan butter, breakfast burros, salads, and sandwiches - if you aren't feeling so eggy. And their portions are quite big, so do come hungry!  The people who work here are very friendly and helpful. My first visit, I had no idea what to order because their menu is a smorgasbord of splendid. They gave me great recommendations - the scrambles and omelettes, and it made me want to come back as a result. They also work hard to make sure your dining experience isn't weak sauce.  Also, The Nosh Cafe is a nice, free wi-fi zone, so don't forget to bring your laptop or touchpad with you and get some actual work or budgeting done. Or better yet...scroll endlessly through your facebook feed and compare yourself to all your successful and not-so-successful friends from high school. All while scarfing down bacon and eggs.  That should bring the feels.  Since I normally work from home, it's great to get a change of scenery. Especially when it's a restaurant where one can destroy a delicious omelette or scramble and not feel so bad afterwards - like when eating at a breakfast joint that rhymes with Benny's.   Oh, I almost forgot - you can purchase a fresh cup of coffee here and get multiple refills! I make sure to lose track of the amount of coffee refills, so  that when I am reunited with my exhausted wife - I just explode energy. She absolutely loves that.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Came with the buttermilk pancake breakfast. Nice combo!

As4WhdofGAtovIjYRP4ifw.text: Fresh Bagel sandwiches are the best! Coda B was obviously still under the influence when he wrote his review because there is no " $7 Arizona Classic" here. All breakfast sandwiches are less than $5 and come with heaping portions of eggs and meat/cheese of your choice. Lunch is also served anytime with mounds of turkey, ham, bacon, or my favorite the "Nosh French Dip" roast beef. Fresh brewed tea is fantastic. You are always greeted with a smile. You are treated like family when you walk in. Thanks for all the great bagels!!

h7x4fxC_Z2fs0WVPlLhjWw.text: Stopped in after MTB south mountain. My boyfriend and I both had the churizo burro and it was great. Not too busy food was served in about 10mins.

AcmhbqGjguyLiaBp74_1SA.text: I had never been here before the remodel so I'm not sure how much has changed, but I really dig the place currently.  It has a very nice contemporary feel and a very complete breakfast menu for being such a small place.  The few times I have been here they have been pretty packed and it can get a bit iffy as you wait for your to go order.  You seem to be in the way no matter where you go.  Aside from that the bagels are delicious, the breakfast burritos are really great and they have excellent OJ.  What more can you want from a breakfast place?  I tried the pancakes which were really good. As is normal for the area they are way bigger than any standard human needs.  They come in three, two, or one.  I went for two, next time it will just be a single.  If you decide to get the three stack bring some hungry friends.  Try: - Pancakes - Breakfast Burrito - Bagels

ENGs4bfU7KptraANS7LmKQ.text: I love The Nosh!  Has been a staple here in Ahwatukee for a while now.  I believe it has changed owners a few times since it first opened, but the current owners are doing a great job!  Very friendly, welcoming staff.  I went there today, just after the morning rush and they seemed very genuine in saying hello and wishing me a great day.  I love the coffee and I love that coffee at these family owned places is usually better than the chain places and also less expensive.  Score!  They have a great selection of bagels and cream cheese, breakfast and lunch sandwiches.  My favorite sandwich is the Nosh Veggie!  Stacked with fresh veggies that really make the bagel sandwich quite refreshing.  Depending on my mood I may get it on a Jalapeno Cheese bagel, or Wheat, or Sesame, or, well, you get the point.  The best part is getting the Garlic Feta Dill cream cheese with all those veggies!  My mouth is watering right now!!  Tons of bicycle folks hanging out on a Saturday morning and a common place for police officers on the weekdays.  Great little spot in the tuke for a casual, quick breakfast or lunch.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Nosh Veggie - Garlic Feta Dill spead is a must!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Enjoying dinner with my Sisters ..

mK48IrZFePxVe_CcjccnUg.text: I am surprised by the good reviews.  I went as a last minute lunch and got a veggie bagel sandwich with fruit and a pickle spear.  It was about $5.50 with tax and I left still hungry.  The bagel was just okay.  The fruit was very fresh and that was a plus.  I have had much better bagel sandwiches.  I miss Brueggers in Chandler.

n-XcUkbq2pQDCOlAdfywOQ.text: Small, claustrophobic inside. Went on a Saturday morning and it was SO hot inside it was uncomfortable. It's the summer people. Keep the air down. Food is mediocre. Probably wouldn't recommend or return

RQxM2Ce8rmPFiGmIDukSvA.text: I just happened upon this place on our way to ikea and we're pleasantly surprised! We came for lunch right before it closed so there weren't many people the workers were extremely friendly and they seem to get along well. Since they were about to close they did not have the bagel I originally wanted but I tried the blueberry with plain cream cheese, most bagels taste the same but I think that the flavor was much better than most. We also had the tombstone wrap with a spinach wrap, it was a little spicy but not overpowering. There was a lot of bacon, which isn't my favorite, but if you like bacon then this sandwich is for you! I will definitely be eating here again.

O1YmpC7gFDLnfR1gxHAilg.text: I am from New York, I have high expectations when it comes to bagels- especially breakfast bagel sandwiches.  By FAR- I have one of the best bacon, egg and cheese on an everything bagel at this cafe. It's clean, quaint and overall adorable.   I also had their creme brulee flavored coffee and fresh orange juice to round out my breakfast and I was not disappointed.  The next day I went back to get the "Go Bananas" bagel sandwich which was bananas, PB and agave nectar- also, incredible.   Even though I was in town just a few days for work, whenever I am in Phoenix, I will make sure to stop by this gem an maybe try the pancakes or french toast :).

6o0lzYiX10R8ncfEEaWnvA.text: I love Bagel Nosh!  I go there for Breakfast and Lunch!  Fantastic Menu with lots of variety!    I highly recommend the Dill Garlic Feta Cream Cheese!  It is wonderful and full of flavor.  You wont turn back!  I love this cream cheese on the whole wheat bagel and I also love it on the turkey bagel sandwich!

8YWfP_x7w03HfWQyq2LqaQ.text: Rob and his wife are  the owners they are great people and the food is great too. It is a local business.  Not a chain. Highly recommend

O9txwoJqYLIu4nIrMFGQRw.text: This is your go to breakfast/brunch in the Ahwatukee/Tempe area.  They make their own bagels, quite the selection and cheap!  This has got to be the best bang for your buck and good quality ingredients to match.  Everything is great here and wide selection of not only breakfast but lunch.   If this is your first visit I would recommend the Apple Smoked Sausage Scramble (they WILL do egg whites on anything for you).  The Breakfast Burrito or for heartier meals... check out their pancakes and biscuits and gravy.  My favorite bagel:  Cinnamon  Sugar or the Raisin with a bunch of Peanut butter spread on top.  Enjoy!

Oxkblt96yqGSJmepJdq2JA.text: Yummy bagel sandwiches for lunch. I had the BLT and was pleasantly surprised to have plenty of perfectly done bacon on my sandwich. Flavor was great. My husband got southwestern bagel sandwich and it had a great flavored spread and also tons of meat. It took about 8-10 min to have our sandwiches prepared so I wouldn't recommend if you're in a hurry. I'm not sure if it always takes this long.

uoOEszRtMwCLDhZDkJJkNA.text: Best breakfast and lunch place in Ahwatukee.Bagels are fresh and second to none, the schmears are homemade and phenomenal, and the pancakes, eggs and sandwiches are the best. Customer service is great, and quality is consistent. Love this place.

EIWkDpoA1qiWeVhL-iDsLg.text: Probably one of the better bagel shops in town.  Its located inside of a shopping plaza, and easy to find as its right next to a Bashas.  I believe they make thier bagels on site.  Fresh, fresh fresh!  I like that.  They also have a great variety of cream cheeses and bagel flavors to choose from on their menu.    They also have a variety of bagel sandwiches to choose from.  Roast beef, tuna, even LOX!  YUMMY.  They also coffee, and some juices and pop as well.  Yippie!  What else I like about this place, is that its just not bagels.  They also have a variety of pastries to choose from, like muffins, and other stuff too.  What else I like about this place is that there is plenty of outdoor seating.  Thats a bonus! Prices are fair and reasonable, and service was fine.  Worth a try if your in the area.

xGn706fpiW3TsEG7nv_chA.text: Rob & Darcy have done an amazing job on the remodel and transforming the cafe into more than just bagels and cream cheese. They have really good coffee as well! The staff, for the most part, is friendly and helpful.   Free wi-fi is a plus! :)

rh7m8eGhNmVrOo_0R1SsNQ.text: I love the Nosh. This place has an awesome selection of bagels and cream cheese flavors. They also have a hot grill for those who prefer omelets, breakfast burritos and egg dishes. My go-to combo is their garlic feta dill cream cheese on their everything bagel. Gotta try their Kona Macadamia coffee too. Delicious!

RqOUg1CA1BQN801-AUExrQ.text: definitely have to go back. had the mtn burrito. will stay and eat next time

IJGLTbbCoK58On5a5AIvSA.text: We love this place! Great food! We just left today disappointed. The young lady said that they closed the grill early, and that we could not order breakfast. They were also putting up chairs at 1:30! We will be sure to get here earlier next time!

MtxcuM_hZps_yBicWqr-qg.text: Place is friendly, menu on wall a little hard to navigate through but nothing to worry about. Service is very fast and coffee tasty. Once I tried my food I was very pleased. I had the Apple smoked chicken sausage scramble and it was really good. One thing I'd like to point is the table, it was a bit dirty. But good over all. Will definitely return since we don't have places like this in Maricopa.

rB18Ey9uvNA5PiNaQAidGg.text: We just happened to be going to play golf at a nearby golf course. We were early and needed breakfast. What a lucky stop for us! The breakfast menu was pretty big. I had the apple chicken sausage scramble. It was delicious! My friend had a bagel breakfast sandwich. Also yummy. Delicious coffee. Friendly staff.  Good prices. It is a order at the counter and they bring your food to your table kind of place. There are several tables inside and a few outside. Their lunch menu looked good, but I can only rate breakfast. It is not too far off of I-10. I will go back the next time I am in town.

X0r75XaLlykZiDzhgvhdOg.text: Great lunch spot. The tombstone wrap is absolutely delicious although they did make the portion slightly smaller it was for the best. Free wifi is great too.

l_XShhKY8RV3bob2C7Zt-g.text: Came here with a friend for lunch and catching up.  The service was patient and friendly. Atmosphere was good, but nothing special. They were accommodating of my friends daughters request to have everything on a separate plate. My Mediterranean omelette was tasty and enjoyed the fresh fruit over hash brown option.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mediterranean omelette

-OUXzTsOKFDA4eMdC7pW0A.text: The food was good, the staff was great.  Three star because no A/C. The place isn't very big so I  wouldn't go if you have a big party.  You order at the counter, then they will bring your food to you.  Over all is the AC was working I would go back but because of that I will move on to a new place. But would send husband to get take out.

frm1F6ca5E1P6vNv8typSQ.text: Having just arrived in the Phoenix area, we were looking for a breakfast location to get vacation started.  I turned to Yelp, and Nosh popped up as one of the top rated spots near us.    They have a wide variety on their menu.  You can go for a scramble, omelette, breakfast sandwich, or something as simple as a bagel.  I decided on the chicken sausage scramble, and I was not disappointed.  The portion was much larger than I expected.  Eggs, chicken sausage, spinach, and cheese all combined in one tasty dish.  They didn't skimp on the meat, which was much appreciated.    Not only was the food tasty, but the prices were super reasonable considering the massive amount of food you get.  Definitely recommend it.  If we had locations in TN, there's no doubt I would be a breakfast regular.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple Smoked Chicken Sausage Scramble

gbcxFIxrupMUut3j4dZgBQ.text: A great breakfast and brunch place. Their menu offers everything from pancakes to bagel sandwiches. Their homemade bagels are fresh and fluffy. They stuff their bagel sandwiches to the max and their breakfast burritos are the same way. Yummy!

vGELhB94gUw52d0XV95KJA.text: This is my second time coming here and being completely satisfied. We came in around 10am when it was slightly busy. Despite this, service, food, and coffee was spot on. I ordered the 2 x4 (2 eggs, your choice of meat, bread, and hashbrowns) and my husband ordered the hog wild on pumpernickel with the cartel coffee. It was delicious and service was fast. There is plenty of seating inside and outside so there were no concerns for seating.   I would definitely come again!

BfPphyvuu2hAASI5lApTpw.text: Been here several times since we live close and I'm not a fan. Wait times are long, my orders get messed up, customer service is indifferent at best, and the worst part, they use a microwave to cook everything. Gross! Seriously, eggs in the microwave is probably the nastiest thing ever. Skip this place. Far better options in Awahtukee for breakfast or brunch.

V2SHSGJ55o0Qh0fbJxO5tQ.text: So finally decided to stop by the Nosh since I drive by it everyday. Walking in I am interested since of course they carry Cartel coffee (amazing) and make their own bagels fresh everyday. Hours are understandable since this is like a bfast brunch place for me. I ordered the Bagel bfast sandwich. It was a great sandwich which I loved. There are many menu items to choose from but beware the bagels go fast. Sooo... anywho. The Grandpa ordered a salad which I must say he loved. He said the greens were fresh along with the other veggies. By far his fav salad. So that is good. I would definitely come back to this place. And I recommend for you to try. The price is reasonable for the portions.

Sc-hIl5PCW_NFm766hQrBw.text: Saturday morning 7:10a.  Just dropped my car off across the street for an oil change and used Yelp to locate Nosh.    Walked right in, went up to the counter to order a build your own Frittata and coffee.  The gal at the counter was very nice and full of energy.  The wait time for my food was acceptable.  My Frittata was good/delish too.  It was delivered hot, tasty and fluffy.  Served with hash browns that were good but average.  I would return.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Corned beef
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Inside

DW-wyG9FgdOhJpbAxbjSyg.text: Sunday breakfast = pancake was in my mind and pancake here is one of better one I had. Fluffy and soft yet has that chewing texture. Their pancake is huge! (See my pics I posted).   Also ordered South Mountain Burro as this name was mentioned several times in reviews. While it doesn't look exceptionally huge, but loaded with protein, perfect breakfast before hiking South Mountain or any mountains.  This place is very small and we got lucky to have found a table after a short wait. Friendly staff and they work hard but it seemed they are understaffed from what I saw on the day I visited.  While it didn't have wow factors but I would still choose this place over chain restaurants next time when I am in the area during breakfast time.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Huge pancake, (put a knife to show the size). Fluffy and really good
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. South Mountain Burro

r7ZACieZr5M4zzfIlNHd2w.text: A little late on this post... I had a great experience. The food was fantastic,  I sorta customized my burrito and the cook Scott went out of his way to make sure I was completely satisfied with my creation and let me tell you it was bomb!!

Pgsp3F3QC7-vldOURojbDg.text: YUM! They have incredible food and it's without a server (order at a register, delivered to your table) so the prices are incredible  I got an egg scramble and it was one of the best I've had

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Apple smoked chicken sausage scramble

gfb2-jMPYfsVDqCSk5zrNg.text: Drove all the way from Mesa to eat the not so common (biscuits and gravy) here. Got there at 1:30 (which they close at 2) and was told that the grill was closed so the only thing that we were allowed to eat were bagels. Extremely disappointed.

av-UpcXK_elRtmBn7uUMFQ.text: I have been getting my to go breakfasts at The Nosh Cafe for over 7 years and I will not deny that the food is fantastic.  This is the reason I continue  to come back. But what I do not like about this establishment is the customer service, especially that of the owner. The counter staff is mediocre at best, they never make eye contact and smile when you approach the counter. They do not say "good morning" or "how are you today?", and I almost always have to repeat my order 2 to 3x before they get it right. It is amazing what a simple smile and acknowledgement will do for a customer in terms of satisfaction.  But unfortunately I don't feel it is their fault, because it all trickles down from the owner. In ALL of the years I have entered this establishment she has not once looked at me, smiled, or acknowledged my existence in any manner, even when she has handed me my food directly. She runs around with her head down, without any smile or look of joy in her eye, and she constantly interacting with her staff in a manner that is not very pleasant. I understand she is working hard and has many responsibilities as the owner, but as a business owner myself I know the importance of customer service and positive interactions with employees.  Anyhow, like I said, food is great, this is what keeps me coming back. But if quality of food were to slip,  I would not return due to customer service.  Just my opinion...for what it's worth.

q9199p_FKJc9Cex1O9CM9Q.text: The service here blows dog dick. Takes up to 10min to put cream cheese on a simple bagel order. I tried to call the order in when I was 12 min away. The girl answered and simply said "the Nosh hold" then placed me on hold. I stayed on the phone all the way up until the point I got to the register and put my order in. After I ordered I asked her "can you still call orders in" she said "yes" and I said well I tried to call and I'm still on hold and showed her my phone. On "hold" for 14 minutes. Once my order was in for 1 bagel with cream cheese it still took 12 min of me standing there. Bullshit. The hassle isn't worth it.

2magwSR2Dt7kHRyBcYeOYw.text: Great breakfast, fast and friendly.  The bagel breakfast sandwich is a favorite of mine.  It is prepared when you order.  fast fresh table delivery.  Mona Mac coffee is excellent.  The owners are great and always working hard.  Pretty extensive menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

huSa-5ik3t5HGba_OGUaEQ.text: When I came here, I witnessed very unprofessional behavior on behalf of the manager at the time. The way the employees were treated was very disrespectful and unbecoming, and I will not be returning. Sad!

TMo7w8yhhQbRrrTz2qJJcQ.text: One of our favorite breakfast spots! We love the bagel breakfast sandwich and the breakfast grilled cheese (which is huge!).

BFeLJRAtYoCStPGjrEleYA.text: This place is awesome! We did breakfast for my wife's birthday. She had the Chorizo breakfast burrito and I had the pancakes. The Chorizo is some of the best I have ever tasted. With each bite, I felt there was a party going on in my mouth! The pancakes were huge and very delicious. Loved that they topped them with butter and pecans.  We have found another great breakfast/brunch place in our neighborhood that we will visit again and again.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancakes with butter and pecans
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Breakfast Burrito

or6aBz8FL-lcklh-DM94Bw.text: Went here today 3/30/18 and was skipped in line for help by the girl in glasses today not once but twice. I said " Hi I havnt ordered yet and she said oh she'll (the cashier) will get you next. The $3.07 bagel was small and just fluff and comes with 2oz cream cheese on the side which is not enough to cover both bagels but a very thin layer. I use to come here every now and then but this place is officially off my list. The Bagel Man on 50th St. Elliot is 100 better in terms of strictly food as it is not a sit down place. Dont take my word for it go give it a try and then you make your own reviews. You get a New York style bagel that weighs twice as much and comes with over twice as much cream cheese on the side. Think its a quarter pound. I usually dont like to give businesses negative reviews but "The Nosh" really needs some constructive criticisms.

V8ppSCNkKiHsoHQZohZacQ.text: I do not give one stars unless the service truly sucked a two is what I can offer only because I went to this place on my lunch hour and it took over 45 mins for me to get french toast which I did not get to eat until I got home for the day and by then the french toast was nasty tasting like over cooked eggs. I cannot tell you what it tasted like while it was still fresh. If I go back to this place it will be when I have nowhere to go and time on my side

cqOLVSb9qc2lndkxmFfz1A.text: We had lunch today. We both ordered the Chicken Salad over green salad  I had the Greek dressing. It was delicious!!

RI0hP4H31FSv_HICxYr4Tw.text: First timer! Food was good and not far from my house. I went around 7:30 on a Monday morning, it wasn't busy and bagels looked well stocked. I order 2 bagel breakfast sandwiches, everything bagel and turkey sausage. The bagel was good but instead of turkey sausage it was turkey bacon. I am not a fan of turkey bacon.... The bagel and egg was good.

VrOxRXlIXHTHrMNEg5dIuQ.text: Super friendly breakfast|lunch joint. This place really wants you to come back as a regular.  The breakfast is good but not incredible, pancakes were a little dry and the syrup didn't taste top of the shelf, bacon could have been better on the crispier side but good flavor. Decent coffee and overall reasonably priced.  You come to this place for the personable staff and the homey feeling.

d8C8IqhKFRhDlWUwvNuhPA.text: Here on a Saturday morning about 10:45 am:  This place is uncomfortably hot. 7-10 bucks a plate. Our server brought the food over and when asked for silverware, instead of kindly bringing some, directs us to the fountain drinks area. Exuding a "whatever" attitude. Flys everywhere. Forks were dirty. The entire staff was sweating.. no theme to eating area and very cluttered. Lots of people here, though. Food was subpar - IHOP-like.

oT5vmySV-MS-BD5h-hCi7g.text: We love The Nosh, in that staff is always very friendly and sweet, we're big customer service people. The food/coffee is great, and we obviously feel good supporting local Ahwatukee small business. We come here all the time and love it.

A0Mz4zx3UTyTAih4TAVb5g.text: Good chef salad and willing to make chicken salad without the bread. Good croutons from bagel chips.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chef salad with lettuce mix
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagel chip croutons - tasty

zOHbnxWx6NYKW42H4ZgbIA.text: While the food is decent, I find it ridiculous they use microwaves to heat most things up. The biggest problem with the this place is their lack of attention to detail. My wife loves this place for some odd reason, but we will no longer be going at all. Without fail, nearly every time I ask to substitute something as simple as the type of cheese on a sandwich, they can't seem to get it right. I am not exaggerating when I say this has occurred approximately 11 out of 12 times I've ordered something there. I'm not asking for anything absurd or ridiculously complicated. It's convenient to go there since it's on the way to work, but I will gladly go out of my way from now on to go to Einstein's and likely pay more just to get my order correct. I like to support local if possible, but I can do so no longer here.

THHFwQg0lQ5U-RtZEZmSsA.text: Eating some of the most fresh crepes I've ever had in my life! Hash browns to die for, omelets big enough for two !  Do need to say more!!

hguaun385l9SEirni3UhvQ.text: Great little place to have breakfast, not big chain food but great quality food! I tend to judge places off the coffee, and it was definitely worth coming back for.

msO5OcaJMME885wDj7c6eg.text: The price list rating here needs to be adjusted, 8 dollars for two eggs and toast with a few hash browns is not one $ it's two$$, if you get a drink it's will over ten for not much food and the taste was mediocre IHOP definitely better

Zw5hZzfT2a2KIQVXvRA6AA.text: This place is great!  The bagel lunch sandwiches are awesome.  I also highly recommend the crepes as they are amazing as well.  Owner is awesome!  I work for Southwest Airlines and love when we have The Nosh cater for any of our events because the food tastes great!

pfbkHQKT-ejH3yAbgcWbzw.text: Breakfast burritos are big size. I had the South Mountain which was yummy! We also had a side of biscuits and gravy and it was very good. I also ordered an iced coffee, very good. Definitely will be back!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast menu
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Menu for lunch

-W3N8VnbhWy4Wj5LcZDLUA.text: Great food, but sooooooo Islow.  Very chaotic and disorganized.  It literally hurts me too go there.

iogB6LVi1QSSjqUzNPyaeA.text: My family and I have been coming to the nosh ever since moving to ahwatukee. This is far more than a bagel shop they have full cooked to order breakfast like omelette's, pancakes, French toast, crepes, scrambles, cooked to order eggs, breakfast burrito etc. as well as a great selection of bagels. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Please support this great local business

L4eJZ-O4mvysiYhzayqr1w.text: the nosh is the best! their bagels and cool cream cheeses are amazing! everyone needs to go here at least once!

X9-hXC6bsiy4-Wuo7nynNg.text: I remember when this place was bagel nosh and it was the only place to get a good bagel. I must say now that there is competition I find myself disappointed.   I know the place offers more than just bagels now but I haven't had the chance to try them so I will stick to my experience. I regularly order a bacon egg and cheese on an everything (works) bagel. I enjoy the quality but here are my issues. Microwaved eggs. I mean really can we get something that doesn't look like it came from subway's breakfast menu this leaves the "eggs" unevenly cooked usually with a hot spot and a flavor that doesn't make you think fresh ingredients.   The bagel even toasted feels greasy and burned in spots because the toaster that it goes through hasn't been cleaned since the bought it and it flames up sometimes.   I will say I prefer this place over Einstein's any day especially Monday's when the bagel man on 51st/Elliot is closed but my money goes to the bagel man 9 times out of 10 now.  If you want to know what a real bagel should taste like head there instead.

QuFP_0v68c2iAUGUNm2QQQ.text: If your oven is being installed and most of your menu can't be made, close for the day.

bqwHiOhl2OAx90LxeOlirw.text: Service was great, everyone was super nice, but the food had zero taste and even made me a bit sick later. I won't go here again

0GCls3vJRDZvFTAaDl_Z2g.text: This place spreads enough cream cheese to feed an entire North Korean village! So gross, old and dirty inside too. Stay far away, there's much better bagels at Einstein just 1 street over.

6n_WcgEaluhCYJ0Urs9pMQ.text: Fast and friendly service, I was in a Brunch mood and this is the perfect place for that! My fiance picked the perfect place to go and the food was fantastic.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. We had so much leftovers. I love places that pack on all the food!

5l_l9MctHo55I0xkpGDX8g.text: Yum! Stumbled upon this place while looking for a breakfast spot in the area.   Delicious cold brew from Cartel with a variety of flavored syrup options and several creamers.   Lots of menu items for both breakfast and lunch. I opted for a bagel breakfast sandwich which was a generous portion. Came with lots of eggs and bacon and it was toasted perfectly.   Dog friendly patio. Lots of seating. Clean interior.   Only thing that wasn't top notch was that the employee at the front counter taking my order wasn't particularly friendly.   If I lived closer this would probably be a regular spot I'd hit up to try different menu items.

dqKT8V0GegNdJAw3KCtpww.text: Went back this morning at 9:20 out of bacon 1 persons order ahead of me got my sandwich at 9:40 ?

SaSv908hN8JbbGzJTdE73w.text: The coffee is decent and they have good bagels. It's a cute and authentic spot in Ahwatukee.

CYc1k9wHdiP5pwMr7Y7ixg.text: This place has great food. Definitely one of our favorite local spots...so why only 3 stars??? They ALWAYS mess up our order. I rarely write reviews but we ordered breakfast to go today and our order was wrong again. This is our third order in a row that has been incorrect. Get it together, Nosh!   Would I recommend the Nosh?...absolutely. I would just advise you to triple check your order.

fef6xEINBKkEUYWKLur-qQ.text: Great place for a quick full and amazing breakfast.  Had the pancake breakfast with egg whites and turkey bacon.  The pancakes are huge and you get two so next time we plan to share.  Food for days and only $10.  Also had the berry smoothie which was refreshing.  I highly recommend The Nosh Cafe and we will return in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancake breakfast with egg white scramble and turkey bacon.

cq2ByvlJ46GUPyojv9LdYA.text: Best breakfast sandwiches  by far!  they have a good selection of bagels and choices/combinations of ingredients to please anyone's cravings. normally we get the bacon, egg and cheese breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel with salt n butter, it is to die for! We  also get the go bananas..monkey... something like that, it is loaded with bananas, pb and honey, we like it on a chocolate chip bagel.  the only flaw is that they do run out of bagels and you do have to wait a bit to get your order, once you have it, it is worth it, but be ready to wait.

Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Classic club

RczFa8hFrz3kYMIxHGWZXQ.text: This is the worst lox works i ever had!!!!! The bagel Man 10 times better!!!! And less money. I dont mind paying but this plase is a rip off!!! I wish i could give it a negative stsrs becaouse i would!!

HTlH11TDIbtuxxiG0HGhEA.text: The menu said Glacier: mocha or vanilla (w/whip), I confirmed with the cashier that this was a frozen coffee so I ordered it.  I then watched them make my drink and it was actually just ice, milk, and a chocolate powder.  There was also no whipped cream.  Something slight and probably just a result of  a confused cashier, but still not pleased with the service and False advertising.

h8C1f_nJpLcuzRRL3pLn-Q.text: I ordered the Southwest Sandwhich and it tasted  nothing related to southwest whatsoever... My friend ordered a simple asiago bagel and she really enjoyed it, although my other friend got the crepes and didn't like them at all. Decent place for a quick bite but not sure if I would want to eat here again.

2eBWQfrelrR4kImIdEa0_w.text: Great brunch spot on the go or eat in. They have first come first serve bistro tables out front that are perfect in non-Summer weather. Quick walk from South Mountain if you need a nice spot after a great hike.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

tFQnkuex-7iHUrxnpaHaAw.text: Absolutely horrible food. Everything is microwaved or processed. The girls take FOREVER to dish out your food. The pancakes are soggy Un flavorful. Anything with egg on it is egg beater frozen and the bagels aren't anything to write home about. Not coming back

-xYCERc2BEF2EdyqmaxC9g.text: Very friendly team and appreciative of your business. The bagels were perfect and delicious as well. Thank you!!!

WzKckfpvErWX4qFSqznUkw.text: This was my first visit and I probably won't bother to return. I had a lunch sandwich wrap and side of macaroni salad. Both were average in taste and appearance with nothing special about either. The price point is higher than say, Panera Bread, for similar items. Portions here are large but uninspiring.

eCu1oewRgitlvHnVy5zKnA.text: After repeatedly going to a few of the same breakfast / brunch places, we figured we would try somewhere new! The Nosh Cafe came up in our Yelp search, so we went at around 11am on Saturday. There was only a short line in the front where they take orders, and I'm not sure how busy the cafe usually gets, but we were able to snag an empty table right away after ordering.   I got a create your own sandwich: toasted jalapeno cheese bagel with veggie cream cheese, turkey, tomatoes, sprouts, red onions, and cucumbers. The sandwich came with either a bag of chips, potato salad, or pasta salad; I chose the potato salad. My fiance ordered the Mediterranean Omelet which had olives, onions, tomatoes, artichokes, spinach, & feta cheese. It came with a side of hash browns.  The first thing we noticed when our order was brought out to us is how large the portions were! The bagel sandwich had a ton of turkey on it along with very thinly sliced veggies. I thought it was good, however it didn't have any unique flavors that I haven't been able to get in the same type of sandwich elsewhere. I did consider when I initially ordered that their non-custom-made sandwiches would maybe be more unique, so I'd be willing to come back to try one of those.  The Mediterranean omelet, similar to the sandwich, was stuffed with a ton of toppings as well. My fiance really liked it and was happy that they didn't skimp on anything, but he did say that the hash browns were just okay. We were not certain if they offer another side with the omelet but if we returned, he would definitely ask about it.  Overall, we had a good experience! Unfortunately, I can't see myself driving out of my way to come here, however it would be somewhere I would consider stopping by if I were already in the area.

They always have kind, college-aged kiddos running around tending to everyone's needs. Life supporting family owned places like Nosh -- it's a great local spot.

npnpeE0tVH135T35Vw5QXw.text: Love this place for breakfast. The bagels are everything. They tend to use too much egg in the sandwiches though. I typically cut it in half because the eggs on the sandwich aren't anything special. Just microwaved.  Was looking forward to their lunch the bagel lunch sandwiches are great. But was really disappointed in their soups. Especially the tomato. Just tasted like tomato sauce. Will continue to go for breakfast of course!

YNx1bnQY4f-PMvfzNdp5Iw.text: I don't get it. We wanted to love this place, but I just can't. We waited in line for 30 minutes to order, and it was busy so we accepted that, but there were a lot of staff in the back and it seemed chaotic. We ordered finally and they ring in the order on one tab and then the girl typed in the total on the square and ended up over charging me. They gave me back cash to fix it once I realized what happened. You can watch them pour the "eggs" from a pitcher and cook them in the microwave. I got a bagel, egg and cheese sandwich, boyfriend got a chorizo burrito. My eggs were brownish green. The bagel was alright. The burrito was okay, chorizo was hard to find there.  And A large cold brew is $5 which is a bit much. Overall it was pretty awful, which is a bummer.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Egg and cheese bagel

LK2OpqFBZftkCjVs7XWa8A.text: Obsessed!!!   I love the fact that this is a neighborhood coffee bar and restaurant that has everything you need to fulfill your tummy.  Food:  I get a bagel sandwich with bacon egg and cheese on everything bagel with chive cream cheese, melts in your mout!! The bagel is doughy but yet has a firm texture on the outside reminds me of an authentic New York bagel.  My kids love the breakfast grilled cheese with sausage egg and cheese. It's extremely cheesy yet the bread is perfectly toasted. Think of a panini and grilled cheese met at breakfast and had a baby.  Lastly let's talk about the coffee!!! Perfectly balanced, aromatic notes and strength. For a coffee drinker like myself who prefers my coffee just black straight up it as the perfect flavor.   I'm excited to come here for lunch and when I come back for breakfast I must try the pancakes all in all this is our new favorite spot.

n6-pxvNvSycTGWdL5SpxyQ.text: Went here for a breakfast. They have a good choice of bagels. The staff are courteous and give you good options to choose. The bagels might be little  costly compared to other places here . But the taste was good. I liked the  panini capresse sandwich. It was at right level of crunchiness and good amount tomatoes and basil leaves paste. It was priced at $8.

yT74hOZpKF44lTYOVWKSjQ.text: I have been coming to [Bagel] Nosh since they first opened here over a decade ago. Came in for a late (11:30) breakfast the other day and the grill had just closed but they still made me the bacon and eggs I came in for. The eggs were cooked perfectly over medium, no runny whites. Love that they have supplemented their bagel business with legit breakfast foods.   Good prices, good portions, good food. Can't really go wrong here and yes, the bagels are really good too. 4/5

NReZD7eshW7lb6UrIrETYg.text: Been here many times and never disappointed. French toadt is awesome! They also make great omelettes and bagel sandwiches. Not a huge staff so you will wait a little while but its worth it. I will keep coming back!

QrzGT-_-f9VtzzQxaDZYSA.text: This is a good breakfast place.  The bagels are good, the lox is tasty, and the sandwiches are plentiful.  Service is reasonably paced and there are tables both indoors and out to enjoy your meal.

okBDSM28BLRunMCljhruwA.text: Wow! My experience was not good today for my first time going into The Nosh!! I paid almost 7 dollars for a bagel with strawberry cream cheese and a mocha coffee, which would have been fine if they were good. My bagel had a substance I couldn't identify on it and the cream cheese was more like yogurt. Not pleasant! Then when I was handed my coffee it was leaking all over the place which was very disappointing as it was a TO GO order and most of it ended up all over my car. The first sip I took over 20 mins after ordering burnt my mouth!!! I'm assuming because the girl making my coffee was too busying chatting and had steamed the milk she added to my coffee to the point it overflowed onto the counter. The person she was chatting with was her manager who was standing right there and saw all of this. I can't believe she proceeded to give me this coffee after that. So disappointed I dont know that I'll ever return which is unfortunate because I live so close. Would NOT recommend!!

Kxs7HxWG1MFMIawnCGnE7w.text: Love this place. I use to live in Awahtukee and now living over 4 hours away I miss the Nosh. I havent had it in over 7-8 years back when it was called Bagel nosh. Its grown and they have a bigger menu. Still love it.

OauQEYbYP5jz71bl4gRg8g.text: Great little place for breakfast.  Hard to find a place that makes quality food that isn't the standard breakfast fast food.  Nice staff, clean location, would recommend.

NghgK-7gWDxEgoEDU3utaw.text: If you stop by you got to try the jalapeno cheese bagels. Soooooo good! Recently just tried the south mountain burrito which was incredibly delicious! It's a great place to simply grab a quick breakfast or even sit for a nice brunch!

ZPruNxToyW3FO393y4xDLw.text: Came in Sunday am and this place was hopping.  They seem to have a lot of regulars.  The hubby and I both had bagel sandwhiches and they were very tasty.  Much better than those at Einstein's... I am pretty sure that place uses powdered eggs.  However, I think I do like the bagels better at Einstein's and they have more flavored cream cheese.  I will probably come to Bagel Nosh again b/c I prefer to support the locally owned businesses over chains but I am not really sure if this place deserves the 4 1/2 stars it currently has.  Maybe part of that is due to my bad experience there.  I ordered a latte with my bagel sandwhich and it took a long time to come out, even after the food.  Then when I finally got it instead of coffee they had given me hot chocolate.  A simple mistake but it can be really jarring when your mouth is expecting one thing and you get another.  Plus I really don't like sugar in the morning and this was extremely sugary sweet.  They did replace it with the latte I ordered but it made me a little grumpy to have to wait so long for my coffee on a Sunday morning so it kind of ruined my day.  I will definitely give them another try and may raise the stars higher in the future.  But I think there are better bagel places in the area.  I LOVE Back East Bagels on Southern and I deeply miss Bruegger's that used to be on Rural and Chandler Blvd - they were the best!

-V2rvSd2Lb0ngPVuR76cIQ.text: Ranchero was savory and delicious...don't forget to add some tobacco sauce and ketchup extra tasty when added on the opposite side of the garlic bagel

KNkoBpj_GeDiYjFGeOmCPw.text: AMAZING food and wonderful service. I have no complaints about this place. One of the best French dip sandwiches I've ever had and their breakfast is wonderful. I will definitely be a loyal customer.

nvHEXJRyjv1VhivE3zFtoQ.text: The staff is really friendly and the service was really fast! That's why I gave 3 stars. But the food was so bland and disappointing. I wanted to check this place out because it had so many good reviews but I don't know why now. I got the South Mountain Burro. Maybe their bagels are amazing. But their food? It's not something I'd come back for.

Za6maqQPrFYGHsiidOkS5Q.text: Hands down the best breakfast and lunch spot in ahwatukee. The food is amazing and the staff is awesome!!! I love this place.

Yr5MBWgnNJlviEKW5VSu2Q.text: By far one of the best bagels I have ever had! I ordered the egg bagel with lox spread my first time here and had to bring my hubby and boys back the next day it was SOO GOOOD!  Hubby ordered the Lox and Works and said it was good, but that they actually gave too much lox, which is unusual for him. (He figures they are losing money on it and could save if they slimmed down the amount they gave.) I used some of his lox on my garlic bagel but was slightly disappointed that the garlic bagel had too much garlic on it, which, when toasted got burned. I love garlic and would've thought garlic would have been in the bagel also not only only on the top. I do think it's a little on the pricey side, but it's local so will support it. All in all, I know I'll go again since it's close to my work and may have to give the glacier a try since others have raved about it.

d5lLf-vJ0Tuzb7NYUSE36Q.text: Everyone is very friendly. The food is awesome. The bagels are better than most from NYC.  The bacon egg and cheese on a bagel is very good.

I will also say that my biggest pet peeve is having your food arrive cold. NOT the case here. My burrito arrived literally hot off the grill just the way I like it. You gotta come here. I assure you that you will not regret it!! Bring the whole family!! Enjoy!!

HLGl4uoYarj-c7HedWWklA.text: Here me out before you agree or disagree! The food and service here is great... Actually for the price it was really good! I am 10 year 3 time Iraqi veteran, my wife and I have vowed not to support businesses that do not support military, this place does not give military discount! :-( so sad!

m79wFJDdHdIqrTHITfWhvA.text: Amazing breakfast!  Get anything you want -  everything is great.  Juat make sure you get a side of pancakes.  They're perfection.

awOaZRo-xsqpD0LQN5YGCw.text: Are you serious? How have I been missing out on this place for so long. Long line at 6 am! But they are a well oiled machine and I barely made up my mind before it was my turn to order. They have tons of regulars, they knew pretty much everyone's name in front of me. j2vpYb5FyWVpiKGHcEexgw.text: Ehh. Another location that supposedly has bagels like back east... Not quite. I ate there and that was that. Bagel Man is still the best in the valley. Places like The Nosh cafe are fine as long as they keep some shoppers from  overcrowding The Bagel Man.

mzYONA-Mj-ewRUShHv8poQ.text: This was our first time visiting on a Saturday at 11 ish for some brunch. It was busy as to be expected. Wait time for food wasn't bad considering. Staff was friendly. I got the lox and works and my husband got the chorizo burrito. The burrito wasn't bad. My husband said he didn't like that it was meat heavy compared to the other ingredients in it. He also didn't feel the burro was worth $7 of food. I was very disappointed with my lox and works. There was a very small amount of salmon and it was covered in cream cheese. All I could taste was cream cheese with a hint of caper and tomato between a bagel. It was way too cream cheese heavy. I was scraping off what I could, trying not to lose capers. The taste was just unbalanced. It needed more salmon and less cream cheese. Not worth the $9. Maybe we came at a bad day? Maybe we ordered the wrong things? But this is what we like. I guess we just have a different taste with what we ordered. We will probably not be back as there are a couple places closer that have the same burrito and lox and works for a cheaper price and it's done the way we like it. There was nothing else that interested me on the menu, otherwise I'd give it another try. It ended up being too similar to the downtown Chandler cafe...just not as good.

TfFBtxQBXg0RAKDPdaFQZw.text: The best place for lox and bagels. The owner works is tail off to make this place a success. I highly recommend this place but get there early. It gets crowded fast as most good places do.

RuxAbxzhfZZQXG7VLzY47g.text: Had the best breakfast here. Had the breakfast grilled cheese which was the best I have ever had of sourdough with cheese, egg and sausage all chopped up together. This is a must have and bug enough for two if not very hungry. Portions are big and prices surprising low...

r3KfVckrzk74tGGC9RFMog.text: We were in the area and the reviews looked good as well as the food so we decided to give it a  try. It was very disappointing. My husband got his food first after about a ten minute wait. It took an additional 10 minutes before my little daughter and myself got our food, by which time my husband's food went cold from waiting. My omelet was bland with no seasoning on it. My daughter's nutella crepe was good. My husband ordered the pancake breakfast, and again no salt or pepper even seasoned the eggs. That's a pretty basic cooking flaw. So between the food being so-so and the having to wait for the food to be separately so far apart we were not impressed.

7NTOWfAJE_QDjaKPR2BWqA.text: My husband and tried this place because it is in the same parking lot as our Gym... after a morning class we stopped in for breakfast... let me tell ya, it was great! The place is neat and clean, service was great, staff super helpful for us first timers, and the food was quickly delivered and we'll made. I had a BLT (my favorite thing to judge new places by)... it was awesome! Ron got the breakfast burrito which rocked!! We can't wait to go back and try their lunch!

P3easrvmHP4o8AKd3gh3Ww.text: To update, I've since been to this cafe several times.  It's been a good experience each and every one of them. To the staff in the front and the back of the house, thank you.

Au5OPCCRf-ed25jKJzJ2nQ.text: Coffee, bagels, and breakfasts are excellent. I have been going to Bagel Nosh regularly for many years. Service is fast and friendly.

_IZ3pC5GaTlaCeyAJlFQNw.text: My first visit to Nosh was great! No waiting an hour for a table and the food was really good. A win-win on a Sunday morning. I ordered a bagel sandwich and a side of hashbrowns. The bagel was 1. Huge 2. Soft and chewy 3. Completely satisfying. The eggs were fluffy and the sausage was flavorful too making for an excellent bagel sandwich. The hashbrowns were also yummy. They were buttery without being greasy, salty and had just the right amount of crispiness. I tried a bite of my friend's pancake and that was good too - very fluffy.  The service was friendly and fast, too. The only downside was that it was a little loud inside. They did have a few tables outside but they were full. Next time if it's not too hot I would probably go outside for a little quiet. But either way, I'll be back!

OEw3MjlZw0fbCt3Pe82GOw.text: We visited The Nosh Cafe while in town for a conference and used Yelp to find something nearby. Great find! The food here is absolutely wonderful. Be prepared for standing in line for a bit though - a good sign. In fact, once I saw the line, I knew that we picked the right place. We surely did!

xWvzl2QRIBnuPuMlbnDoPg.text: Just ate breakfast with my family.  Environment is positive and comfortable.  Food was great!  Service was friendly and helpful....

7d3ZCYbbrKEisVAhthuN6g.text: This place has the best food in town. Huge sandwiches with the tastiest bacon. Super friendly and chill place to hang out. I can't wait to try the whole menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. So much goodness!

VdxfzIbR7n6aNc0juTBMRg.text: Very disappointing! There are much better places to go for bagels and breakfast stuff.The service is lacking both in efficiency and friendliness. Actually the girl behind the counter was rude and discourteous. The food was just ok nothing special The best thing about eating there is I don't ever have to eat there again Can't imagine they'll be in business for long Yuk :(

Mx2XMzQ3conLDch6VzknHw.text: Visiting from out of town for spring training and we ended up eating here every morning cuz the food and service were amazing!!!!! The food taste fresh, homemade, and a lot of healthy options!!! Would definitely recommend this place for anyone in search of a healthy, hearty breakfast with incredibly nice employees!!!!!!

3DMR-sfJtBmPebFi5nCCXQ.text: DO NOT COME HERE IF YOU DO NOT HAVE 30+ MINUES TO SPARE. Let me start off by saying I usually never write bad reviews and tend to just brush a bad experience off or give them the benefit of the doubt. However this experience actually affected me beyond just my order. This was my first time at Nosh cafe and my last. I had work at 10 a.m and so I woke up early in order to get coffee and breakfast. After I left Starbucks in the bashas next door, I went to Nosh Cafe to try something new at 9:30. I figured I had 20 minutes to spare and since it was a breakfast place I figured they could get a simple to go order of a simple bagel with spread in under 20 minutes. I was very wrong. 20 minutes pass by and still no bagel and several people who ordered before me were still waiting for their bagel so I had to call my manager and let them know I had already paid for my food and could not just leave and that I would be a little late. Thankfully my manager is very understanding and told me not to worry about being late. After I got off the phone, at 9:55 they decide to tell me they don't have the bagel to complete my order. I was in disbelief because they had not started my order even though it had been 25 minutes. I told them I was already late for work and to just give me my money back or give me a different bagel in 30 seconds so I could leave. They were able to get that bagel out in record time surprisingly. I will not be coming back it was very slow service and not to mention the food was not worth that wait or being late for work.

qSEo3D9stYwHCa2e66RFXQ.text: Long wait time for average food. One meal came out 10 minutes before the others' and then got a lame excuse for why the wait was so long. Go to IHOP instead, service and food are better.

aiuLfabMQ3wu1SjOmuKHPg.text: Really good bagel breakfast sandwich. They loaded on the bacon, it was perfectly cooked, and the jalapeno cheese bagel I picked it to be on had a nice flavor. Only downfall was that the food took forever to come out. Vistied on a Sunday morning around 10.

hcVFtG73kQWFRNPi_TQ7Gw.text: We get breakfast here at least once a month. Consistently good. We usually order the South Mountain Burrito, Lox with Works, and whatever the one is with the banana and peanut butter!

mOt-U_yRKcrQrv_DATmvzQ.text: It's been a while since I've been here, but this was unexpected! Half a slice of bacon on bagel sandwich. Cashier got upset with me when I complained and bought extra bacon. Probably won't come back. Hillside is across the street and costs about the same.

I walked in an immediately saw the breakfast enchilada special and decided to order it, They had me at 'green Chile and hash brows'.  My husband ordered 2 grand pancakes which were fluffy and soft, sweet and filled the entire plate.  The service is great and tables were all clean and ready for guests.  For our first time being here we will definitely return.  We ordered 3 breakfast and 2 drinks for $38

We ordered the Granddaddy's BELT ( full disclosure, I always order this, it's my favorite) The Bagel sandwich, 2 plain bagels and a cinnamon roll. Everything was top notch.  The sandwiches and bagels are bigger and less expensive here than other bagel shops in our area.   Thanks Nosh!!

AYRE6ZnURc-qPQl3u-9Gmg.text: First of all, I just want to say a BIG thank you for being so generous and offering federal employees a free meal during the shutdown. It's a token of appreciation that goes a long way after going a month or so without a paycheck.  This was my first time at the Nosh Cafe, and I called in an order for a Grilled Turkey Club sandwich. Nothing too fancy, but it was still delicious with very good ingredients. I will certainly be coming back again!

I ordered a breakfast grilled cheese and it took about 30 min. Good food, fair price and casual environment but wasn't expecting the long wait time. Hope to see improvement.
