t9YXnQ16bNcTVzcU-DXcsw.text: I came in for the first time today. It was a quick ordering process. Bagels are good however the salmon when you order the lox is super salty. I I had to remind the waitress that I ordered a cappuccino and it was awful sadly. The waitresses were friendly enough but it's not good enough to give a good review  I will not be returning here again sadly.

-qo1XqHvs8o3R6-ggUjsDg.text: When you go to a place and order two bagel sandwiches (it's not busy and takes 25 minutes to get your 'to go' order). You get home and they made one of your sandwiches with 'sliced white bread'. You are frustrated and do a one star Yelp review. So very frustrating. Not a picture available that will accurately depict said frustration. Guess you need to open up all of your sandwiches before you walk out the door here.

ydjQKjXhkY8MTegNIZhe4w.text: I really wanted to like this place. When placing our order, the lady had trouble inputting the prices. She seemed all over the place and said she is just ready to be closed for the day. The place closed at 2 and we got there at 130. This was not the issue though.   I ordered the country omelet. The description seems enticing. It was served with hash browns, but theres also hash browns in the omelet. There was sausage inside as well as cheese. It was covered in a sausage gravy. I was looking forwarded to this gravy, but it was tasteless. Just the first bite of the omelet was just lack luster. The dish only improved once I put ketchup, and I don't usually like to use ketchup. But this seemed like a necessity.   I also ordered a chicken soup. The chicken noodle soup was the best item I tried there. It was very chunky and had flavor. It wasn't the best chicken noodle soup I've had, but it was definitely better than the country omelet, in my opinion.   The coffee was good too.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country omelet and chicken noodle soup

1dF2ksScUCguzvvsTBFgEQ.text: This was a great place for breakfast! I ordered the pancake meal with a side of hash browns and bacon. The pancakes were huge, I needed some help to eat them and there was still some left at the end of the meal. The bacon was thick and delicious. The hash browns were thin and maybe a bit over cooked. But that didnt stop me from enjoying a great breakfast. You order at the counter and the food is brought to your table, the wait time was short.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancakes, bacon, hash browns

ctZbX2b7iczQXM_D-PvwuA.text: They had a help wanted sign up and I can see why. Nosh is a nice local place that makes a tasty bagel, so we thought we were in for a pleasant lunch by stopping at this old favorite. We were very disappointed. Ordered a bagel sandwich and a toasted bagel to go. It was pretty busy so we expected some wait, but started getting concerned when we saw the people who ordered before us finish their food before we even got ours. About 25 minutes.  I went up to the counter to see where they were on our order. They had our tickets still with the bagel done. They said the sandwich was being worked on and they would bring it out. So I thought to myself, only one more minute. Nope, 10 more minutes passed. I go up see what they are doing.  They said they were still working on it. The bagel for my wife was now getting cold so I bring that back so she could eat something. I then went back and watched one girl behind the counter pealing cheese slices, while the other girl watched. I'm hoping this was just a bad day, because these girls moved slow. I've done food service. A sandwich takes one minute to make. A bagel the same. We should have received our food within 5 minutes if them starting the order. Wouldn't it be a great customer experience to start and complete an order in a timely fashion? Then bring the food out all at once before it gets cold.   I don't think we will be back anytime soon.

zz6ggslcBUKby6-h2bd4lg.text: So it looks like there seems to be a theme recently with people having to wait ~40 minutes for their food while watching others get theirs. It sucks but I'll have to be another person to report that this has happened to.  I get that things get backed up or something goes wrong. It's natural and I've been in food service long enough to not complain about waiting a bit longer than usual, but 40 minutes for an omelette seems a bit ridiculous.  I didn't have time to wait any longer for it so I just got a refund instead, so one plus I can say is that the refund process was pleasantly painless.

Jq0D6nNSStnxT2Its2rXKQ.text: I'm not entirely crazy about this place. I wanted a certain bagel but the lady at the register responded like I'm suppose to know they ran out. And then I just told her I'll grab an everything bagel. Tell me why they put so much cream cheese on there? Lathered an inch on there like they ready to get rid of all their cream cheese? Anyways I'm ok with going to the bagel man down the street :) 4 stars cause vibe was great and atmosphere was there.

LFv4GOYbL2cq8J8j-b4Tww.text: Not impressed. Breakfast sandwich, see pic, is rubber eggs, with raw.ham slapped on top, with a piece of.cheese slapped on, then a barely.warm (asked for.toasted) bagel. Ive never given a review anywhere but was THAT dissapointed in sandwich, had to. Iced tea was good i suppose  Appended: talked to owner, really nice guy, if you want a breakfast sandwich and arent inna hurry, MAKE SURE TO ASK FOR GRILLED SANDWICH, otherwise they do the quick microwave job.    Owner is worth giving a second chance

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Not good. Rubber and just felt like four independant &#34;things&#34;, not one sandwich. Wont be returning

ZpQQabvnk1RBm3PoV7ykbA.text: This place used to be one of my favorite places to get a pancake (breakfast) Unfortunately I have tried them for the last time. Today was a True display of poor customer etiquette. Even when a comment is made to management they just acknowledge the problem and move on. The recent problems and shortcomings are as followed:   Poor seating - no handicap seating or signs suggesting proper etiquette for table arrangements. (1 person sitting at a 4 person table for hours on end with a coffee and their laptop)  Cold food - runners are not quickly delivering food that is ready, as it sits in the window.   Poor customer etiquette which is leading to a declining atmosphere.   I've been a patron since moving to Phoenix in 2012. No longer will I visit the Nosh, nor will I promote it through word of mouth advertising.

mkgJJgS3wEBtE_pQPn15kQ.text: We love everything about this place.....food, menu, staff and a great neighborhood cafe. We have visited twice this past week and ordered the brekafast quesadilla and banana nutella crepe again, it was so good! Plus the weather is great this week in Phoenix, which is perfect with their outdoor seating option.

1qsRWSmFxFy6qYgeNWhyUA.text: We went here for breakfast last weekend. My experience here was not good. I got a breakfast bagel that didn't seem to be baked completely. Doughy inside. I asked for it to be toasted and it was not. An irregular amount of fake egg product used in the sandwich. So much I had to take it off. In the end I only ate the rest of the meat and left the egg stuff and bagel. All in all the sandwich was bland. Almost no flavor.   To top it off the Latte I ordered wasn't hazelnut. When I went back I learned the ran out. Huh, could have told me. I'm not sure what flavor the gave me but it wasn't hazelnut.  I gave a two because my wife wasn't disappointed in her meal. Just a bagel and cream cheese.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagel not baked completely and so much fake egg product.

8OdnlpOAfgCY8KoIG2JzRg.text: Service is always so-so here. The coffee is just alright--I usually stop somewhere else first if I'm craving caffeine. However the bagels are delicious and HUGE. I usually cut them in half otherwise I'm uncomfortably full. Make sure to get your bagel toasted--if you don't, it'll taste super doughy.   The best thing about this place is the bag of "old" (next-day) bagels for $1.99! It's a steal!

9VbAbCBaD-AjxZkDPb6UkA.text: I have been going to the Nosh Cafe for years. I love their Kona coffee and their Sesame bagels are my favorite. The service is always great, I'm always greeted with a smile. Keep up the great work Nosh family!

Jpqg0P2NkoRFnA3kOnt-Tg.text: First time here! Brought my mom who's visiting from Cali! We loved it!! The portions were so big! Leftover eggs and ham for lunch yay!!! The employees were very nice. Quick service. Good food. I loved it. I live really close so I'll definitely be coming back :)   I got the pancake breakfast plate, my mom got the inlet with sausage and county gravy (maybe called country inlets- can't remember exactly lol) I got coffee, her tea- $23 for both!!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Good hash browns
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Omg the pancakes!!!!! A plate to share for sure!!!

sxfmBMomvVTfIzoz-ONSaA.text: Great little local breakfast/lunch place. We ordered steak and cheese sandwich, club sandwich, jalapeno bagel with cream cheese, and chicken Caesar wrap, peanut butter protein shake. All of it was pretty good. Decent size portions for the price.   We ends up having leftovers.   Place could use a POS terminal for cashier in order to make the ordering process a little smoother.   We will be back! Nice job!

wGx-MZtcHBqH9B-h8kFM9Q.text: This bagel shop is excellent, even with a big crowd they know how to have perfect service. Their breakfast sandwich was on point, and the orange juice to match. I will probably come back for their bagels, maybe a half a dozen next time.

_rJRaYy-kEYHAbo0IGoeAg.text: Food was delicious and nice big portions. We ordered everything from breakfast sandwiches to omelets to pancakes and French toast. The iced coffee was delicious as well. They did mess up our order (forgot one of the entrees, and even they did bring the pancakes they forgot the eggs/bacon) but they made it up by sending us home with some bagels and cream cheese. Pretty sure we will be back! Only downside is the seating is limited.

9NMcPM8LM8zXRvg1DG2Q8A.text: My favorite place to eat breakfast! I love the wonderful they serve. And the French roast coffee is to die for!! It's always busy with guests coming and going, but I never have to wait too long for my food! It's never wrong and I am never ever disappointed. I'm so glad my fiance had me try this place out, I do not regret it! It's a short distance away and it's something we don't eat often, so it never gets old!

gL3nLOr-7bxAf77IrVcueQ.text: The food was really good. Nice size helpings. The eggs were cooked right and the bacon was crispy! We had a slice of blueberry coffee cake that was made right there by their pastry chef! Staff is very friendly. Everyone works hard, you can tell. Good choice for a birthday breakfast.

l9Z6tgdsZdHlLaPPUpTIWg.text: Searched Yelp for best nearby breakfast burrito and ended up at The Nosh. Great burrito and the menu had several other great looking items. Great find when I am in town.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Breakfast menu

6EaA5-kXzENfnmaJAbIwkg.text: If you like Lox bagels then you'll love this place. It puts Einstein bagels to shame.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

sXeaDaPfzoH4YvmocoVvcA.text: I love this place. Food is good and yummy coffee and tea. It's just the long line and inefficient ordering process could use an overhaul. Please, please on busy hours add another order taker or something.

j2E86g0kerF2WT1Xap5wdA.text: I like the food here...it is gross to watch the girl making the breakfast sandwich without TWO gloves and using the exposed hand (just hoping it's clean. Cross contamination must not be a big deal).the owner seems to have favorite customers. He has a bunch of younger girls working which is fine but as I stood in line I witness what looks like cattiness and 'tude...not towards the customer however. My only recommendation: call in your order, add an extra 5 minutes to their pick up time and you Will be good. Breakfast burrito and pancakes are always a good choice here  ADDITION: we waited for our order to be called (they call by name) they call our name and totally ignore us giving our order to the guys sitting right next to us. When we go and ask if he had just said "Kevin" the owner , without even looking up, completely dismisses us "no I didn't say Kevin" but then walks over to the guy and says "are you Kevin?" He says no and LUCKILY (or else shit would've hit the fan) the dudes order was exactly our order so their screw up was easily fix. Sooo clearly customer service isn't their strong suite

jcGDIO_vlq0h1BcUcEPZJw.text: We had the chorizo scramble and sausage/mushroom/cheddar omelet without toast or potatoes - they picked up we were avoiding starches and offered fruit, which was sweet of them! Food was quite tasty. Fast, friendly service. Well priced and bright & welcoming atmosphere. It was our second trip as we enjoyed the first trip so much - we just travel through a few times a year on the way to visit family :)

eJoMghUguUXXWFmOvy_wBA.text: Great Service, fresh food, nice selection from breakfast to lunch items.   It is worth the wait as lines can be long on the weekend.

wj8aL3uAFfYy1GCTPV8zGA.text: Always been curious about the nosh and when we finally stopped in, we were stuck with flavorless food. Eh. I wasn't pleased but people watching while we sat outside to eat was very well worth it. Bunch of crazy table stealers. Ha. No need to return since one visit was enough for us.

ONfEFXAxAwe-2ixy3L2Xdw.text: First let me say that I am a bagel snob.  Being Jewish and having spent most of my life in NY NY, I literally grew up and lived on the Real Thing - bagels and authentic Jewish Deli food.  Given this life long exposure I feel I can confidently say there really is NOTHING special about this place.  Bagels yes.  Better than nothing YES!  Anything remotely close to what I know is possible... No!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Mmm mmm good

OmgSPrjfrh34OQfNCLce5Q.text: If your like myself a bagel loving New Jersey Jew then this place will satisfy the craving for a great bagel.Big fluffy and crunchy at the same time and adding the cream cheese and lox will only cost you 9.00 so a good deal too

6k1uyjJ3smcKqkhssyCG7A.text: This is one of our go-to places for weekend breakfast. We always get the same thing even though the menu has changed a lot over the years. There are now a lot of options for hot breakfast but we come here for the delicious bagels. We always share a bagel breakfast sandwich and a banana nut bagel. The bagels are crunchy on the outside and chewy in the middle just the way I love them.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Bagel breakfast sandwich on an everything bagel.
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Banana nut bagel with butter

J2u3_JK89S0n-jE6I-GWBA.text: Love this place....My wife and I go for the coffee at least once a week. The reason for the non 5 star is the service. There is an army of of employees standing around behind the counter with no sense of urgency or purpose. They need guidance and structure to accomplish so much more than they are. Plus, open up a separate line for drinks only and pick up orders. We waited for 30 min for 2 ice coffees. Passed up twice to ring up pick up orders. This just leaves a bad taste in your mouth of importance and makes a customer think, "this place ain't that good".

hz7YhGN8GJB_IJ8VuSdhSQ.text: Called in our bagel order ahead so we could get fresh bagels. Was told to pick up in 25 minutes. Only to arrive and nothing was ready. Our order list was still on the counter and never made. Meanwhile the bagels we ordered were sold out. Waited another 15 minutes for our new food order to be ready. Unbelievable! Worst customer service ever!

jzEcUvzhYkzPVmu3_3BWMQ.text: We followed the previous Yelp reviews to this place on a late Thursday morning. Menu was standard cafe stuff, nothing too fancy, nor too bad. Service was alright - the girl was on her phone taking some call-in orders and we had to wait like 5 minutes before we could order our breakfasts. But then, just as we watched the people after us got served one by one, our food just refused to show up for a good 30 minutes. My patience wore thin at that time and just decided to leave, by when our food was still nowhere to be sighted in the kitchen. Outrageous. Outrageous. Would not recommend this place to anyone.

73e9xQXLLKtExx9Q2P6iXw.text: Great breakfast, big servings, very clean, good service. The Frittata was excellent, the pancakes are divine. Great variety of dishes to pick from.. The Nosh Cafe will be our regular spot for breakfast! You won't be disappointed.

Ap5AJQF3B5VVqOtQUKouGg.text: I've been going to this place for a few years now, always good, always friendly and always delicious food. The Chorizo Burro is outstanding, you gotta try that, get extra cheese and potatoes on it. You won't regret it!

8oQynIvie_w0fq_FS4vKLQ.text: I love this place!! Best breakfast spot In Ahwatukee  My favorite is the yogurt parfait and Go bananas bagel  I have raved about this place to most of my co works and once they tried they agreed!!

LN1emXtnICI9cUapZVAJ-w.text: Terrible service. 20 mins for 3 bagel sandwiches. 7 people working here. They started by getting the order wrong. What do I circle??? Cheddar? I'm so confused! This job is so hard! OMG I have to update my Facebook status! I'll just make something up and hope the customer doesn't come back since it's a to go order.   Owners:  You need to provide better training to your flock of teenage employees!

rBiVrQiZeX3DMJaJYSxuFA.text: This place continues to suck. Service sucks when it's busy, service sucks when it's slow.  While I was waiting over 10 minutes, another lady came up to the counter to discuss an issue with her order. keep in mind there was nobody in front of me and nobody behind me waiting for food.    The younger girl that was working cashier could have cared less about customer service today. She took my money through the bagels and the toaster and then walked to the kitchen and relaxed while my bagels sat on the counter getting cold. Slurped on her drink with no cares in the world.  When the other customer came up to discuss her incorrect order, she didn't even turn around to acknowledge and apologize. The older lady just defended their inaction.  After waiting over 10 minutes for two basic bagels to get some schmear, I told the older lady with curly black hair I would like a refund. Never once did she ask why. She didn't need to. She knows this place sucks.   I really wish this place would fix the issues, but Rob doesn't care, the staff doesn't care. I've never wished a small mom & pop business would close, until now. But glass half full, I hope this place closes so a new owner with passion and priorities will open a new shop.   Called to speak to Rob, of course he's out of town. I truly hate this place and will not be back.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Owners response

YlrkJ6kzLNV2IaXDCn2wKA.text: Good food. Small tables. Small sitting area. It's in a  shopping center you might miss if you didn't know it was there. The prices were decent IMO. Most plates were marked at $10. You order at the counter and then sit down and they bring it to you. The food was good but the servers were not friendly. At least the ones I encountered. I would eat here again though because I did like the food, just probably with a party of four or less which is hard because we are a family of five lol.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Nutella banana crepes. Sooo good.
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country omelette or something like that. Sausage gravy on top. Stuffed with more sausage. Has a spicy kick for sure. So delicious and huge.
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Fruit crepes.

UZLkTADlgjMNi_iJqJj4OA.text: Excellent little place, customer service and food was great. Had the veggie omelet and it was very good.

z3VJBQTQsCmz7zWqxUfSvw.text: What a great place for breakfast! The place is not too fancy, trendy, or big...it's just comfortable, cozy, and delicious.   The Chorizo Burrito is great. It is a gigantic burrito filled with eggs, tomatoes, sausage and other goodies. They cut it in half and sprinkle shredded cheese on the opening, and it just melts to this glorious cheesy breakfast burrito that will leave you full until dinner.   The house coffee is strong and flavorful. The best part is that is it bottomless...free refills!   Come hungry, come tired, come ready to be satisfied.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Burro

2D5T0hcYnD75Zt7Ek-_I0g.text: Holy crap, what has happened to this place? I used to love coming here because the food is delicious, but the kids running this place and making the food don't have a clue what they're doing.   We came on a Sunday, just ordered a toasted bagel and a turkey bagel. It didn't seem too complicated and it was busy so we expected a wait, but after 25 minutes we went to the counter to see if they forgot about us. After being promised it was going to be done in 15 seconds we came back up after another 10 minutes and they finally decided it was ready. Waiting almost 40 minutes for two stupid bagels is ridiculous. There were tons of other people complaining and asking for the manager because of the long wait or an issue with the food being too cold. I seriously hate whining about anything, but this was just a terrible visit and I would definitely not recommend this place to anyone.

n_3elDqYF-ScuoDowQbNtw.text: I love this place! They have great breakfast burritos (they call them burros) and fresh tasty bagels. They also have tasty iced mochas and some decent orange juice. I'm always impressed at how accommodating they are to my wife and daughters food requests. Beware that they are often busy on the weekends but the line moves fast and the service is friendly. There is outdoor seating if you don't want to be in the crowded and slightly noisy inside. We live farther away now but it's worth the extra drive.  They are located in a strip mall type location so there is ample parking and places to park your bicycle.   I usually pick apart bathrooms but I don't think I've ever used their facilities, so I can't judge.

nz4C3GJHhz7nuhmJkDAsAg.text: This is a cute little cafe with great food! The service was great, the food was fresh and hot, and although busy, we really enjoyed ourselves.  The chorizo burrito and cheerful plate were great. The bagels are large and so fresh!

JuZXmDpVB0dySJwp77YvbA.text: This place is fairly small so I don't recommend a big crowd, if you bring one, the biggest table (if you can get it) seats 6 people and it is a high top. It is self seating after you place your order at the register, get your serving number and sit down. The patio.is dog friendly, so if you would like to being the fur babies, you can. Our visit, this particular time was, meh, okay. We placed our order, got our number and sat down. It was a cold morning so why they had the side door open so the cold air with a light, but artic breeze, could get in, I do not know. We live in Arizona so I will be honest, I am sensitive to the cold so maybe it felt nice to someone, but it was majorly uncomfortable for us. Luckily, shortly after sitting down, someone may have complained because one of the workers came and shut the door. We ordered 2 yogurt parfaits and a hot chocolate. A lady came out with one yogurt parfait, then wanted to take our number, having had this happen before, I didn't want her taking our number until we received the rest of our order so she asked, "Well, what else did you order?" We told her, "Another parfait and a hot chocolate." She looked down at her piece of paper and let out the biggest sigh. Went back. Came back with our other parfait about 10mins later. Took awhile to get the hot chocolate, which did not taste like hot chocolate. It tasted like... hot sugar water. The parfaits were good. The service was lacking but, understandably, I think it may have been because they appeared to be short staffed. Overall, meh. It was okay. We don't expect to come back anytime soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Yogurt parfait!

_ktdTRcAzHuAOOq98kZF1Q.text: HOLY GREEN CHILI BURRITO GOODNESS!!!!  Ok, I may have never found this place but Donna wanted to try it out. I wasn't really hungry so I just ordered the oatmeal which is good...   Donna ordered the Green Chili Burrito of goodness! We had to share that burrito because it was SOOOO GOOOOD!!! The sauce covering it was some kind of amazing unknown deliciousness that we have since been back several times for.   At this point that burrito is so good, I can not see myself eating anything else here at all in fear of missing out on the awesomeness of this meal!!!  Stop by and for the sake of goodness eat this burrito!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green Chili Enchilada Burro
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Oatmeal bowl

2VTtritb58kzIb5gDZhBLA.text: Huge portions and Great prices. You will not be disappointed.  I had the Chorizo Breakfast Burrito that was massive. It was so flavorful and the salsa that was served with it was absolutely perfect.  I'm actually not a big breakfast eater so when I came here I was coming to eat a meal because it was breakfast time and I "should". Apparently it's the most important meal.  However, by the time I left, my plate was completely empty and I contemplated getting a second one. Just kidding. Or am I?  Such flavorful food, quiet location, good prices.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Chorizo Breakfast Burrito

jlkwpjg0yC_HEWQPkezzjw.text: They are very tasty ! Try the Salt Bagel breakfast sandwich. He always loves the country omelet. Super nice peeps with great food. It's worth the wait if the are busy.

CwGGHN1me9tEiUWaRetG6w.text: Loved the French toast!! Will be back for that! If you like crispy bacon  this is the bacon for you! I only have a four because the hash browns in my burrito were more like mashed potatoes... ended up scraping them out. Upside, the Salsa was really good!!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. South Mountain burrito
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast

Vt2QlbXOS9U_F3xi79UYkA.text: Found this breakfast/brunch spot on YELP, of course.  First time I came in, I ordered a bagel with strawberry cream cheese. Nothing special, but they do make their bagel and cream cheese! Which, I liked because it was freshly made.   The second time I came in, I saw the Green Chile Burrito! Which looked amazing, so I needed to try it. It comes with chorizo, that I substituted for steak instead.   OHHHH MY GOODNESS. When I took the first bite, it all just melted in my mouth. The green chiles, eggs, hash browns, steak, beans, and all the yummy goodness hit all my taste buds. It was just a special they were having on the weekends that was so popular that they are adding it to the menu now. The green chile was not spicy, to me. It might be for others. I highly recommended trying the Green Chile Burrito.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Green enchilada burrito. With steak.

Na1h0jV-IqySNFN9PPyfHQ.text: Decided to stop by The Nosh Cafe for a Saturday morning breakfast prior to hitting the outlet mall for some shopping. There were about 5 people in front of us in line and it remained steady throughout our visit. The line did move quickly and we were able to grab a table to wait for our food after placing our order.   Drinks: My husband ordered a caramel hazelnut latte and he really enjoyed it, I ordered decaf drip coffee and when I went to get some (drip coffee is self serv), there was enough for about a half a cup. No worries though, they brewed more and brought it directly out to me when it was ready.   Food: I ordered the Two x Four which was 2 scrambled eggs, 2 pieces of bacon, whole wheat toast, and hash browns. I wasnt really a fan of any portion of my meal but the toast. The toast, I would come back just to order it, the bread was thick and the toastiness was perfect. They serve it with a strawberry jam that complimented it well. I would order the toast again, and again, but I dont see myself ordering the never eggs or bacon from Nosh again.   Husband had the Pancake breakfast with scrambled eggs and sausage (and he ate my hash browns). He was happy with his meal.  The PANCAKES are phenomenal. They are super fluffy, the pecan butter is so good, and they are huge. In fact, even with me picking at his pancake as we ate, only about 1/2 of 1 pancake was eaten, and he ordered 2. We brought the leftovers home and did not eat them, and I'm not sure if he is going to.   The pancakes, toast, and made to order coffee drinks are worthy of a 5 star rating. Everything else brought it down to an overall 4. I would recommend Nosh Cafe to others and do see this being a place I return to in the future for a pancake and an espresso beverage.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The pancake breakfast and the two x four pictured together.
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Two x Four with bacon, scrambled eggs, whole wheat toast, and hashbrowns. The toast was amazing!
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancake breakfast. 2 fluffy pancakes, 2 sausage links, and 2 scrambled eggs.

pBZe6sFuv_gjIaMXyaMc-A.text: Really had high hopes for this place especially upon arrival. It's hidden which is fine and great location for lots of traffic. Walking to the door you can see the line out the door which means great things always.   Come to find out we were wrong here. Menu and everything looked great till, where it went wrong was after ordering our food.  Drinks came out at a reasonable time, but the smoothie tasted watered down and with frozen strawberries that tasted like they been in the freezer for awhile.    As busy as they were they were completely unorganized.  Even with what it looked like 6 people behind the counter and 4 of them cooking it took at least 30 minutes maybe longer just to get our food.   Food arrives was thinking heck this looks amazing maybe I'll rethink the wait for the food.  Nope not one bit, about to take a bite of my food notice a hair probably nothing big but being mad waiting of course it's now a big deal. Tell the lady about didn't seem apologetic just asked what I wanted to go so I got a bagel so I didnt have to wait.  Then my fiance's food she couldn't finish it tasted like they threw a handful of salt on the potatoes.    After leaving we started reading google reviews, should of read those first.  The way the manager replied made it look like he doesn't care about the customers and just wants there money.   Enter at your own risk but we will no longer be coming here

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Tiny hair but the being mad at the wait made me think there&#39;s more I can&#39;t see

f6cMO3twhHxEfExJ5bZyIA.text: Came on a Sunday around 10:45am and it's 11:30 and my husband still has not received his bagel. The tables next to me are discussing how they have been waiting 35 minutes for their burrito.   I love to frequent small locally owned businesses but a wait this long will force myself and others to take our business to places with a quicker turn around.    In the end we had to request a refund.

b2ZtXZU3VqIkKk_1hk2Tdg.text: This place is a cluster, they need to get their systems and processes down better. Takes forever for everything and it may be incorrect.

IRALPD9V6TSUPrfUgF4evA.text: Slowly but surely getting over nosh... been a long time regular customer but the service seems to keep getting worse and worse. There seems to be no process for orders and although the bagels are great, not sure if they are worth the wait and service anymore.

5952yQihg1RUXbEHc6cc7A.text: This place has seriously gone downhill over the past few year. I don't know if the ownership changed, if they lost staff or if they simply don't care about running the business correctly anymore and taking care of customers. The staff is not prepared to handle a crowd, they seem to always run out of food and you could see either one of the staff or a man that seems to be the owner, running to the Bashas next door to purchase things they have run out of. They take over 30 minutes to deliver food, on average, even if it's just a bagel with cream cheese and they seem to have to "re-make" a lot of orders that are being delivered wrong. I do have to say this man (owner) seems to be happy to re-make any order a customer is unhappy with, however the question should truly be, WHY is it necessary to re-make orders? Shouldn't they be right, and TIMELY in the first place? and keep in mind these orders are being remade after customers have already had to wait 30 minutes for their food in the first place and it has already been delivered wrong and cold. Does the food taste good? Yeah, it's fine. It's not so "out of this world incredible" that I would be willing to put myself through such bad service. Keep in mind they are constantly running to  the grocery store to get pre-prepped stuff to make the food and it's not like it's being made from scratch. The man behind the counter, and sometimes in the kitchen argues this is from scratch, but you tell me that he is telling the truth when you can ask any customer sitting there how many times someone has walked in with a grocery store bag and goes behind the counter to prepare food. I could do the same thing at home without paying the premium price and waiting in line to get a wrong and cold order. Besides all of that, He doesn't seem to treat his staff very well. He has been seen yelling and even cursing at them in the back kitchen and has even directed himself in a not-so polite manner to customers who have gotten upset over their orders. I visited this place at least 15 times thinking I was going at "the wrong time" but I quickly figured out, EVERY time is the wrong time.

cabvBNhvhLutKmDl2ddm1g.text: I was recommended by a friend and this is hands down one of the best breakfast spot in the area. The staffs are amazingly friendly. The food are yummy and did I mention the portion was HUGE? Their chai latte is on point too! Simply good food with chill environment for breakfast. Definitely coming back again.

jIhAE76LMGqzrWaxf6KzOA.text: Nosh is a nice breakfast spot.  These got dam fresh bagels tho.  I'm loving the sweet options including egg whites and turkey or chicken sausage, variety of cream cheeses including low fat but I usually just go with the egg white sandwich.  Great food.

J-8bbGlTsLeh0gAN3sVBkg.text: I have been going to The Nosh for several years and it's always, always a tasty experience. I can't stay away from the Lox and Works because it's amazingly delicious. They must use top quality lox because it's better than anywhere else. The mochas are excellent and I saw the owner making one himself- they use Ghirardelli Chocolate!!! YUM!!! I always recommend The Nosh to family and friends because it's so good. Oh!!! Also, they have a dog friendly patio with water bowls for the puppy patrons.

C5b-RriuZdlir0oXHetaNA.text: Great bagels, friendly people, quick service, nice modern decor and spectacular drawing on the menu (in the wall). They sweat the little details like the sauce and condiments section all nearly stacked. The girls that work there are all young so they might not be the most refined taking the dishes and trays out of your way but they do smile all the time!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Salad and sandwich menu
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Drink menu, all hand drawn!!!!

Fn3H0HrnM88lbd1NKrnDxg.text: Slow line, self serve coffee all out at 1030, chorizo eggs were orange Cat food slop. Staff was nice!

f744FGcMb3Q9h4Qhte7f_A.text: The only surprise was that this is not a "traditional restaurant" (and we did not see any indication otherwise on these reviews?) - in that you order at the counter, and then they bring the food to you.  They use large "air-pots" for their coffee, and if it's not full, the coffee is lukewarm.  The new pot was not only hot, but very tasty.  The bacon was a little under cooked.  The pancakes are quite large, but nothing special.

OFf9VCdm1xThxyKRXlExTg.text: Enjoying a South Mountain burro quite thoroughly! First time trying this and would recommend it. The Bagel Breakfast (bagel sandwich) is my usual go to breakfast, and it is awesome. Bagels are literally minutes from the oven (made on site). Everything is fresh....I'm gushing on I know. I've lived in this neighborhood for 30 years and have been a customer since they opened I don't know how long ago. The staff are great, energetic young people and the owners work right along side them. A couple of the staff know me by name. (I've worked retail and know how hard it is to remember peoples names. It's part of the attraction to this neighborhood right-around-the-corner  restauran

WCd5n8Y9hEU7EZZaJK6dMQ.text: We travel to Arizona 3 times a year to visit family and Nosh Cafe is always a stop we have to make! These are the most flavorful, fresh and tastiest bagels we've ever had! The lattes and freshly squeezed orange juice are such a perfect pairing to our savory breakfast sandwiches! The service is great and we're always so pleased with our stop en route back to California! Can't wait to be back in March!!!

IzMTcZZbxIIiao74zYe29g.text: Food is delicious, atmosphere is cute & tidy, and the restaurant includes a lot of outdoor patio seating. 4 stars instead of 5 because service is a little slow and they confused our order. But overall well worth the visit! I definitely recommend this place.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Hog wild on jalapeño cheddar bagel with chive cream cheese. SO YUMMY!!

yICJNURMfgPqMRm9az3Y-g.text: Food is good, they messed up my order though, for a first timer they don't really explain how it works and waited for my food for over a hour. Being in the food industry I understand but still ridiculous probably not coming back With that kind of wait.

XKOqOKP7_BbIDwNqCCbYeQ.text: This was our first visit to The Nosh, and we really enjoyed it.   I had a breakfast sandwich that consisted of scrambled eggs, bacon, and cheddar cheese on a garlic bagel. They put a lot of bacon on the sandwich. It wasn't as crispy as I prefer, but I still enjoyed it. I also had an iced coffee, which was pretty good.  The people in front of us in line seemed to have several questions, which made our wait a bit long but it also gave us a chance to really study the menu and choose which bagels we wanted so we knew exactly what we would be ordering once it was our turn.   The food took a bit longer than I would have liked, but it was a busy Saturday mid-morning, so it wasn't a big deal.

uBnsBlgaQ-hy0Wa5GBm6lg.text: I liked this place. The staff was cheerful and friendly. Service was quick. I had the Two x Four (2 eggs, hashbrowns & toast with your choice of bacon, ham or sausage) and my wife had The Cheerful (1 egg, a pancake, hash browns & 1 piece of bacon, ham or sausage). Our food was tasty and cooked exactly as requested, but my wife's pancake was exceptional. I would eat there again.

1AsmtLwydYu9jZor8yx1BA.text: A well made, last minute decision to eat out here instead of I hop.  It's understandably a crowded place. It took them a little while to get us our food. But the choices one can have and the taste is worth the wait.  Will go back here again. By the way servings are of a good size. So better be hungry when you go here.

xZVDK79e_q3p2YeINGUhlA.text: Ok - i said before that this place had amazing breakfast and lunch was still good but not quite up to par....I will eat my words. I swung by today to grab a bagel sandwich or wrap and ended up doing the "create your own" and it was FANTASTIC. I ordered bacon & turkey on my sandwhich and we all know what that means - "oh they'll probably throw 1/2 a strip of bacon on there since i'm ordering 2 meats..." Nope. It was a decent pile of bacon on there and perfectly crispy. Added avocado & lettuce, tomato, & a bit if mayo. Man, I love this place!!

A_AMwW8SmqRVX0hmYSrKKQ.text: My wife and I are always looking for good breakfast places. We heard about this place from a friend who lives almost 20 miles away but always stops by when he is in the area, so thought it must be good.  We came in and were greated by a friendly staff. Food came out fast and was delicious. The atmosphere is relaxed and the coffee is really good. I think we found our new breakfast spot.

C77Hcf9OtPeJmyEWlx8oNw.text: Stopped here for a quick breakfast bagel and coffee to go after staying at a hotel across the street. The standard breakfast bagel with bacon was super delicious and super filling! Definitely worth coming back to!

rxwcYhvZvKX1fcxjMHROCw.text: This place is always great.  The quality of food is excellent (especially their bagels), there is hardly ever much of a wait, and the people working there are super friendly.  I go here for breakfast or lunch at least once a week.  I love the Tombstone Wrap, but you gotta be careful with that spicy cream cheese they use!

NFx-yG7bEHuNoW4621QMAA.text: This place is amazing.  The biscuits and gravey are my go to almost every time I walk in to that place.  Anybody who goes there needs to try this!   The breakfast burrito is a close second.  Having these two items on the menu makes me think gaining weight and eating both may be worth it.    The bagels are a great way to go as well.  They have very good cream cheese and the bages are always very fresh.

LSL4akkrkJxe6KX9fOcIGA.text: I recently visited The Nosh Cafe for breakfast and was impressed with the friendly staff and lack of wait times (even when they were busy).   I chose  the South Mountain Burro which hit the spot perfectly. Tasty and filling but not so much that I felt like a lead balloon afterwards!  The most important thing for me was the coffee. Delicious house coffee - apparently roasted locally so that's a winner :).

jJMSJIQK2aG6YpmNs6xBMA.text: The food is usually very good with good prices. Normally I would give this place a 4 or 5 star review, but today the service and food were pretty bad. The food was overcooked to the point it was not edible and half of the staff was screwing around flirting with a guy they call marky mark. The owner if he was there would not have been happy. It's too bad that you can't leave your restaurant and know that the staff will take care of it. He needs cameras to watch the staff in his absence.

CRhybg7GHMHzBinmCOuj8g.text: This place is great for a quick morning snack, following a long bike ride. They have a good selection of bagels and they taste so fresh. Nothing like a fresh toasted bagel with a nice spongey core on a Saturday morning!

z3Eswj8GxaYckjqKgPowmA.text: Great bagels, always baked fresh. Lots of other brealfast and lunch items on the menu. Staff is always friendly. I come here regularly and have never been disappointed.

EGXFV-U7MwDJDan2c1CgKA.text: This place is ok. I've only ever tried breakfast bagel sandwiches. The bagels are good. Eggs have no flavor, not even salt and pepper. Customer service could be way better. Outdoor seating is a bonus.

CiqL6cipJtXnBwDh5YW99Q.text: Tried the veggie bagel sandwich today. Liked it with the fruits side. Potato salad isn't veggie since it contains egg.

gidQhsxEzIFgHpkgOIgrCw.text: I eat here all the time, some weeks every morning. The food and service is good, but the customers are horrible. This is a small place and it's one of those places where you have to fight for a table and people will walk in the door, grab a table as fast as they can, and then send someone up to make the order. They have no regard for folks who are literally standing there with food in their hands who've been waiting for a table for 10 plus minutes. This morning for example, there were four tables nabbed by rude customers that just walked in the door as I clearly stood there with my food. Three other tables had people camped out on them who had finished eating before I even walked in. I really don't get any of these people.

gmOyvcrx6N_ld8i-3NygVg.text: I started going here probably a year ago, and it has turned into a 3 to 4 time a week ordeal. Not only do they have delicious bagels and cream cheese (try the chive!), they have a number of other breakfast and lunch items. I have loved everything I have tried so far.  As for the service.... It's excellent. Most of the employees know me by name and are always smiling and happy. It'd be one thing to simply get good food, but it's the best experience I really enjoy.  Even when the boss isn't around, they find the perfect mix of friendly and efficient. Do expect to wait a while on the weekends and busy morning hours, but it's for a good reason.  I highly recommend this place to anyone wanting to enjoy a nice meal in a nice environment.

4VuZs6PMFi_dRqjiQrz8Sg.text: Love Bagel Nosh! The staff is so friendly and of course the food is delicious! I have to admit that the pumpkin latte was no Starbucks pumpkin latte, but the pumpkin cream cheese was amazing! ( I do realize it's no longer pumpkin season, I was just wishing I had some anyway) It can get busy on the weekend mornings, esp since the bike shop opened up next door, but I find it well worth the wait! (Oh, and fyi it closes at 2:30 - so get your coffee early!)

h3dtkeLav5o3e-9yQ3nuJQ.text: Happened to be near, so I dropped in about a month ago.  Oh, my word, had the best bagel I've had in such a long time.  I've since had bagels from Chompies (just okay) and NY Bagels&Baily (fairly good).  But I keep thinking about the bagel I had from BagelNosh... it left such an impression on me.  I am even tempted to drive across town just to have another bagel from here.  And, the staff were very nice.

OpMqtSfdMjMNgddYcHXg4w.text: BEST PANCAKES!!! We want the recipe. They're newly remodeled and better than ever. Always great bagels but now they have added more menu items, more choices. Great food, great people!

jA6uWXM2RyVHxoCB7cGHBg.text: I'm a regular at Bagel Nosh. They learned my name right away and miss me when I don't come in for awhile. They even know what and how I like my bagel! They have the yummiest Mocha Glacier- i'm totally addicted! It's not bitter at all - it's sweet and a lot better than Sbx! They are always busy in the mornings but they keep the line moving - so it's never a problem. You know if cops eat there...it's good and they are there EVERY morning!! The girls are so nice... Now I'm craving a bagel and Mocha Glacier - thanks!  Elaine

UgalvSfNxe5PpnugBGomIQ.text: The Nosh is as good as it gets. Although it closes at 2pm daily and the bad customer service, the bagel sandwiches are extremely good! Nosh, is also one of the few joints that still carries spouts. Which i love!

RHjmzDiSxBO7a9W84_R35g.text: i'm starving, so i'm going to write a review for the place i'd like to go to lunch to today.  they have the most delicious bagel sandwiches anywhere! i think it has something to do with my new obsession with mustard - here you have three choices, which they apply liberally .  There never seems to be anyone in line (except in the morning hours) so i can order and sit down or be back at the office in no time. they have booths, tables and outside patio tables.   $7 for sandwich, chips and a drink, and it kicks subway or sub factory's ass.   damn i'm hungry.

xPVo8BQbREXXP4UTzQ86Dg.text: Just a quick review.  I've been there countless times.  On my way out to go for a bike ride.  On my way home from a bike ride.  Or in the middle of a ride for a quick respite.  Its always a tasty treat and relaxing experience worth looking forward to.  And no matter when I go, I can always count on great bagels, delicious cream cheeses and great service.  I don't think I've ever had negative experience; this is partially due to the owners, Rob and Darcy (sp?), that seem to really try to make the place as friendly and good as they can make it.  One hint about it, try their new Nosh Bars.  They are a little piece of delectable heaven.

hSdsNEkdlCM39CKGLNXd1w.text: delicious bagels and cream cheese. this place always hits the spot. it does get crowded during certain hours, mostly on weekends. They have the best bagles and cream cheese. Around Halloween/Thanksgiving they have pumpkin bagels and pumpkin cream cheese and they are yummy! I also enjoy their veggie sandwich and roast beef sandwich.

LMux-YarBpmNwDHggzwB9Q.text: this is a great family-run bagel shop. They remember your name after only a few times in and the bagels are always fresh. good coffee and the lox is good. I have nothing but good things to say here.

4lP8ylv9FgMHbFCtoUhkpg.text: there is one problem with bagel nosh: it's not close enough to tempe! went there on a sunday a little before closing-the bagel selection was sparse but they offered to get us any kind of bagel we wanted. the garlic,feta, and dill cream cheese was amazing and the breakfast sandwich looked hella yummy! went to get a refill on our way out and the owner offered a free large glass of iced tea since they were about to close. the service was great andi might have to make the trip out there very soon!

owUOfD14JDJVwFZxgE3TaA.text: I've never been a huge fan of bagel sandwiches. I've always preferred just getting a toasted bagel and cream cheese when I frequent a bagel shop. However, the Nosh Bagelry not only has really, really good bagels and cream cheese (with lots of flavors to choose from for both), they also have affordably-priced and delicious bagel sandwiches. My husband and I tried the Nosh Veggie sandwich and the Nosh French Dip. The Veggie was standard but delicious, with veggie cream cheese and a bagel of my choice (I chose onion, naturally), and for only $4.99, I also got potato salad and a pickle. I know the French Dip ($5.99) sounds strange on a bagel, but it was surprisingly really good. The roast beef was decent, and the garlic bagel he chose added a little something special. One delicious touch was that the bagel was buttered; this, along with the au jus, made it rich and flavorful. I will definitely return here for either breakfast or lunch if I'm in the area.

Fw1ta2Ty_lg_YfJV46-2Yw.text: The service, and the considerate people is what makes this business successful. Of course the food is excellent but there are similar restaurants in the area but have terrible servers. I mean lousy attitudes, this place makes it enjoyable to eat and spend time there.

nYRb-1tDuG_R8334F3l0CA.text: Good little cafe for breakfast, can be crowded but it's pretty fast.  I ordered the french toast and veggie omelette. Got the chai tea. Omelette was alright, nothing special but it hit the spot. The french toaat was soft and amazing. Still love hillside a lot more but definitely will come back for the toast!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Veggie omelette
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. French toast

4Y1fjCCmSARheWfkNK49lw.text: What a cute little local bagel shop in Ahwatukee! I came here with a group of students, and the Nosh was more than accommodating! I called about 30 minutes before we arrived and the employees gladly set up a large table for our group outside. Further, they were so patient and kind to my students. The food was decent and well priced. I had a bagel egg sandwich with bacon for around 6$... not bad at all. They even cooked my egg over medium... fantastic! I would highly recommend the Nosh!

UFYEi5q89MD2GsDvRZpclw.text: So disappointed today. This is one of the few places I can get a decent (not great) bagel and lox in AZ. Went for lunch with my husband and we each ordered. I specifically asked for my garlic bagel (the last one) to be lightly toasted since I hate burned anything. My husband got a sandwich on a Works bagel and an iced coffee. Everything took way longer than it should have for only a few customers and that nothing we ordered required any cooking. My husband's coffee tasted more like vanilla syrup than anything else, his sandwich was on a sesame seed bagel not the Works like he ordered, and my garlic bagel was burnt black on the top. When I told one of the girls she offered me a free bagel or to remake our meals. We didn't have another 15 minutes to wait for them to remake our meals as slowly as they made them. Sorry when I pay, I expect to get what I ordered and 3 errors on a single order is staff being lazy and clearly not valuing customers time or money.   Additionally the guy sitting next to us who had ordered long before us had to ask for his food. I'm not sure what was going on but I think I saw 4 employees so I'm confused what anyone was doing.

oiSL_fOutuiZS-El301U_Q.text: Love the Nosh! Great food and fun, busy neighborhood restaurant. We've been coming here for years and love it!

mwpIAbxZ1XGQSFwNsUQy7Q.text: Yikes. This place needs better organization with their staff. I called ahead my order but still had to stand in the long line.  I even asked several hostesses what I should do but I wasn't helped. 20 minutes in line before I finally got to the cash register to pick up my to go order. Even though the girl wrote down the order correctly on the ticket (chorizo scramble) I got a chorizo burro--so I end up paying a dollar extra for an item that's cheaper and not what I ordered.  The food is pretty good itself but pretty basic....definitely not worth the wait and the stress of ordering and getting incorrect items. My experience was very stressful. They have about 6 girls working there all seeming confused and running around in every which way getting things mixed up. I may go back to pick up just bagels but nothing else that requires much effort on their end.

VDFE8c8Gn3z98oz0rkgzzw.text: Food was alright. My disappointment was the corned beef hash. It basically tasted like strips of pot roast with potatoes. Not quite what I think it should be. I may come back again. The coffee was good.

mos7TMEp14FdgbuA-wpvgg.text: I just discovered this GEM a few weeks ago...DELICIOUS food! Great service! This is my new breakfast spot! I've already taken some friends here that didn't know it existed.

0vatEwugJliMGdUeYlNrEg.text: In town on business and was looking for a good breakfast place. Checked out Crackers and Hillside spot on Yelp, yet they didn't open until 7 am.  I decided to try this place and was glad that I did.  Great food with big portions, clean restaurant, and good customer service!  Not sure how long this place has been in service, but you can tell it is a hit with the locals.  I highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country Omelette.  Big portions and good!
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Country Omelette.  Big portions and good!

OK7Am_ZKnTgWbItWo-PUBQ.text: Great breakfast. Friendly people. Good atmosphere. The dill feta cream cheese is amazing! And they have good wifi. If you don't like what you ordered or it's too salty they are very kind about remaking it. They know how to cook a good egg btw ... most places I got can't make an over medium egg.

4yjsEru2zSQ2kHFLik8_LQ.text: I like this place and happy it isn't far from home, but my order is ALWAYS wrong or mixed up and they're just slow in general.

d9cmXts0bXQF4011lW48hA.text: i've been here quite a few times and it was delicious but after this time i will not return. my boyfriend and I both ordered the grilled steak skillet that was 9$ each. it took about 20 minutes in the first place but then by the time we got it, it literally had 5 pieces of steak!!!!! and then the eggs were super nasty, almost like they were cheap eggs! so I complained because this unacceptable for the price we payed and it didn't have the same consistency from the last time I had it. they made us more steak but by the time we got it we were already finished with our food... never coming back.

ZH9IGDXsTZw-q0KAgPvoKg.text: Just tried this place yesterday & I am in love. I ordered a cheese bagel with sweet habanero spread. It was the yummiest thing ever!! I sadly didn't get to try it until I got to work and by then it was cold but still delicious. It was so good I went back this morning and ordered it again! This time I ate it on my way to work. So yummy when it's warm and toasty! I will probably be back tomorrow and will try to make myself try something new. There are a lot of options!   While I am in love with the bagel, the coffee was just meh. One review on here mentions that the mocha is better than Starbucks. I would have to disagree. Tried the latte today and was also not impressed. I like my coffee to be more on the sweet side though.  Also the older woman who is mentioned in another review is just as you described: short with words and grumpy. It's kind of a turn off but when the bagel is that good I will put up with it!   I don't like the debit card machine and the place to tip. I feel obligated to tip every time because they just look at you waiting for your response. I don't mind tipping but if I'm just getting a to go order is it really necessary?

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. The Ranchero on a works bagel &amp; orange juice

xbAnZ05PDTCxSB5-TJsjjw.text: Great bagels, freshly made! Also, the Pancakes are fluffy, large and delicious. And on my last visit I finally tried the Wraps and those are outstanding too!  This is my favorite place to grab food after a run, hike or race on weekends :)  Dog friendly patio too :) :)

DiwlhQ_OwkKNGs6UGRwPZw.text: My husband and I had a truly awful experience here today, and won't be returning. Left feedback via square and the owner completely flipped out and sent back a wildly unprofessional response. While the food here is good (usually) the 30+ minute wait time is just unacceptable. I let them know in my feedback that I was dissappointed we waited more than 25min to receive a bagel and french toast, and after saying how everyone works their asses off and that I'm a terrible person for even being upset, their response was that we should have asked where our food was... Okay? Why should I have to ask where my order is, you should be organized and efficient enough to get orders out in a timely manner. To top it all off, they originally gave is a single slice of bread as the $6 french toast we ordered. I could buy a whole loaf of bread and a dozen eggs for cheaper. Plus, it had been sitting in the window so long the butter they put on the side was completely melted and saturated the bread to the point where it was spongy and far too rich to be enjoyable.  Just BEWARE you will be waiting a very long time if you go to the NOSH and only some of the food is worth it. Oh and if you try to give feedback someone will respond with wild and unprofessional accusations rather than try and see what they can do it make it right.

rDrdIKRHAiLnkfwKyU9qtw.text: I love this place.  It's become my regular breakfast/brunch spot.  Delicious food and friendly staff.

d7jSexx6yAU6oWH-Lq3Ksw.text: First time at Nosh. Quite the line at 11am on Sunday, but it moved quickly and the girls behind the counter were efficient and polite. We had the chorizo burro, the morning beer, and a jalapeno cheddar bagel with veggie cream cheese. They were out of the works bagel, which is why I chose jalapeno. While we were waiting on our good, the young man came outside and said they were out of chibatta, so I had to choose something else for my sandwich. I chose sourdough, and my sandwich was decent. Just lacked wow factor. Chorizo burrito was also ok. Bagel was excellent, as was the veggie cream cheese. Would definitely gone back for bagels and cream cheese!

Zsb7m3rSyhFtIePiT4Toag.text: Shared the tombstone wrap and grilled turkey club. Both were amazing! And the service was great, too. Can't wait to go back and try the breakfast options. I was surprised by the variety of the breakfast menu.

xsfd91GEnz7JJKF2zF0O2g.text: Took some out of town business guests Food was good and fresh Ordered breakfast burritos and omelet  Everyone thought it was great and especially raved about coffee too Order at counter and they bring to your table

-GAbWAnBXxzV9xWWKragyQ.text: Great food! Different menu than any other bagel shop I've been to.

6BAAOuKfBzwdS_ZWDwSLKw.text: Very clean place but if it's your first time they don't tell you that you need to get silver ware prior on your own. Food was awesome and service was great. Very friendly and respectful, it was like they new me.  Defiantly recommend this place. Great place to take a computer and do work or just grab breakfast.   Update... I came in on a Saturday morning. Waited 23 minutes for my food to only come out wrong. Avocado toast.... didn't know it was hard....

Pxw8C8wdysKFfhqV6AL9tw.text: I can completely thank Yelp App for this great find, I was way too early to head into work and wanted some breakfast and not from a fast food chain, so I looked what was in the area and found the Nosh Cafe so off I went.  When I got there it had a little line, but don't worry, it moves sort of fast, while waiting in line I checked out the menu board and saw they had a lot going on, that I want to try it all, but I had to limit my choice to just one this time around.  Now they have breakfasts off the grill and breakfast sandwiches, so I knew the sandwiched sounded good, so I checked out the selection and went with the Ranchero on a jalapeno bagel and a large caramel latte. The Ranchero was egg, sausage, red onion & house made southwest cream cheese; it was a great breakfast bagel sandwich.  Happy to had found Nosh Cafe, and saw they do lunch and its less than 2 miles from my work, so I can pretty much say I will be back again soon.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Southwestern
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Ranchero bagel sandwich

IuO9NcYpIMlSIPrJiprx6A.text: After an extremely long wait in line to order, I ordered 5 bagels with cream cheese. All bagels we're different flavors, I did want 2 the same but they only had one so I ordered it, they toasted all 5 bagels. After 11min of our bagels sitting there waiting to have the cream cheese added and packed up I had to ask if would be much longer. They said they were working on it now, so 1 min later they handed me a bag, not a thank you, have a good day, no mention of sorry for the wait! I open the bag to check our order while I'm still at the counter and we only had 4 of our 5 bagels! Yup, the one that was the "last one" not in the bag! Obviously, I let them know that we are missing a bagel and 2 of the 4 we have are burnt (not the biggest deal). Well my bagel went missing and they have no idea how or why! So after 15min I'm pissed and I tell them take the bagels and refund my money! They really didn't care that they just lost a customer! I bet they will care when they realize that I love YELP and always give an honest review and give credit where credit is due! I wouldn't give them another chance if it was free! Back to The Bagel Man @ 5035 E ELLIOT RD, they have amazing bagels and good customer service!

Uzw5rmWktf9YjavbnenO6g.text: SO good. Stopped by here for takeout when we were n the area & got the chorizo burro and the lox bagel - both were amazing & pretty big. We will definitely be back.

kA_bYaUTJTEOfukPqx4G7w.text: First time here... And let me tell you... So very yummy!!! I spent more then I wanted to, but I was happy. The food, coffee and staff were great.

kIpTu-koz8OeKdogCEx4_w.text: Good place for breakfast. Specially if you are looking for eggs you should come here. I am not a fan of their coffee though.  I think they should work on the coffee and cappuccino.

CQPFm_3DsC0jnPO4CTocAA.text: I love this bagel shop. Discovered this through work as it is the go to place for bagel Fridays.  The works bagel, toasted with cream cheese is all I need for a happy morning!

vdfl20IPYxzmEEJCuQ3w7g.text: Very nice and friendly little joint. Offers a nice variety of breakfast. My son ordered 2 pancakes and he was only able to eat 1, they are pretty big and delicious !!  Our breakfast plates were very nicely loaded too. We enjoyed it very much and weren't hungry for lunch at all after that. Try it out, it's worth it.

gUbluTja8e_JshP-0vSn8w.text: Nosh hits the spot!  My family and I stopped here for a game time decision, and oh my Nosh they didn't disappoint me.  We Had a great breakfast, I got the 2x4 because I was in a traditional breakfast kinda mood, while my wife got the burrito (#great) and my son with the p-cakes.  This place is tasty food without the extra $20 added to the bill.   We Will for sure be popping in here again!

v76zI265t_uBWcuKAWqVXQ.text: So I went to The Nosh today. The service was very slow and the girl who took my order was very rude to not only me, but also her coworkers. People who came in after us got their food faster and it has taken over 40 minutes just to make a bagel and a side of bacon. I am very unimpressed with this restaurant and will not be coming back.

BTih-6jUGmGWkDTjDsLntQ.text: I absolutely love this place! It's small and intimate and my favorite neighborhood breakfast place. The food is tasty and the staff is always friendly. The South Mountain Burro is my favorite. It's huge! Very tasty and filling. I love coming and sipping on my coffee and reading here when I have time. My favorite coffee is the Kona and you get unlimited refills, which is always a plus

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

bDJB7VEWJBdnvjjJCe2rJg.text: Great food, service (even when they're super busy), and menu selection!  My family and I tried this place for the first time late Saturday morning. It was very busy with not enough seating.  However, the line moved at a nice pace & we were eventually able to snag a table as soon as some other patrons had left.   Pancakes are huge and delicious. As are their breakfast sandwiches and bagels. The Oriental Chicken salad is delish! Great portion with a lovely amount of chicken on top. The dressing is superb!  The staff is five star! . Polite, friendly, efficient, and very hard-working team!

oTyEVR2z-T-fLwStngszNA.text: Great environment, friendly service, and good prices. I got the The Cheerful Breakfast which is 1 egg, hash browns, 1 pancake, and bacon, sausage link, ham. I'm not a big fan of ham so I go it with Bacon, a side of Sausage, and an extra egg with cheese.   Everything was amazing. The Pancake was one of the best I've ever had, only downfall for me was the butter. It had walnuts mixed in which is creative but I'm not a big fan of nuts. But the butter was very flavorful and after I scraped off the but I was good to go.   This was my first time here and the menu had a lot of great options. But my first time places I try to stick with something traditional, if they mess that up I won't be back for the complex or special. I recommend it to everyone ASAP!   I will be coming back soon to try the lunch menu.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Pancake was amazing.
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

-xQaT5PhRCfhC9GsJFiXfQ.text: Best brunch in a long time! We will be back. Everything was real good. I had the Country Omelet, which totally hit the spot. More than reasonable pricing as well.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

L4d85gjZAYMPPG_na9pCoQ.text: Nosh used to be my favorite breakfast and it is right around the corner from my house which made it easy. However, Nosh has gone downhill! The service is terrible. It took 30 minutes to get 2 bagels toasted with cream cheese. I always ask for light amount of cream cheese and they continue to add too much. I mean enough to cover 3 bagels! If they do that well, then they forget something else. The bagels are always cold. The quality of the taste of the bagels Is no longer as good as it used to be. They need to bring up their service and quality in order for me to go back.  Update as of 8/14, Service is incredibly slow--slower than before. The girls that work there don't know what they are doing it seems. They have messed up more order now 2Xs. I can no longer come back to this establishment.

569rgFbbU-oC4LMZHwzzRQ.text: I liked this place. An around the corner cafe. Nothing fancy - a good egg sandwich and a nice variety. Place was clean and friendly

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

CspYbrb9g0IOQmnclY3B6A.text: This place is amazing! I wish one was closer to me. I would stop here everyday before work. I visited The Nosh on a Saturday. And fell in love with all the bagel selection. The service was fast and the crowd of people drew me in.   I ended up with a breakfast bagel that had eggs/bacon and cheese. It was amazing! I thought they would only put like 2slices of bacon. They loaded my bagel with bacon and I was in Heaven. The prices are very reasonable and the staff is very nice. One staff even came from behind the counter to help me hunt down some grape jelly that had ran out. I recommend this place to everyone! I hope they expand the business! I will actually be making a trip to The Nosh this weekend! A+++++

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. My handsome nephew waiting on his bagel with cream cheese!
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States
Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States

YavdV1QKS3crPNo-W5K2Qg.text: Bagels were just ok. The flavor is pretty good but the texture is way off from what a great bagel should be. They too thin and there is no crisp outer layer. Instead outer layer is tough and difficult to eat makes me think of what eating dry skin would be like.   The real disappointing part of Nosh is that they microwave all their food.  They have three microwaves displayed prominently like its a good thing. Flavorless eggs (probably powdered) microwaved doesn't improve the poor texture of the bagels.

photos.caption: Photo of The Nosh Cafe - Phoenix, AZ, United States. Works bagel with cream cheese

c5t9bX-pNgK7J9miI7VTRg.text: Fantastic Bagels Went to this place based on Yelp reviews and it was a hit. Loved it.  Bagels were amazing; seating area outside was great; atmosphere was great. Will definitively return.

sr1s0_b5OZiqJNRjNwrypw.text: I was not impressed with this place and am kind of shocked that it has as high of reviews as it does. I do not like the cramped tiny space and how it is located in a strip mall. I see that a lot of the good reviews are of the bagels they serve. Hmmm. I didn't think you could screw up bagels. I do not see anything special about this place but it did seem that it catered to locals and wasn't touristy.

qKkIzG8ef95W1wYFBKCeaQ.text: Solid breakfast place in Ahwatukee!  I had the lox, and it was really good lox - as fresh as salmon in the desert gets.  The sweet habanero cream cheese was delicious, too, and I haven't seen that anywhere else.  There are about 10 things I want to try on my next visit!

L5zts55ML06O_vKgxW7a1Q.text: Love this place! Definitely our go to breakfast stop, love the bagels and the South Mountain Burro is the best!

yVkt007qG7zGsdfP4C_oIg.text: The Nosh is ok.  Bagels are mediocre, nothing special.  The older lady who works behind the counter should stay at home.  She's short worded, unwelcoming, and flat out rude to customers.  If you want a real bagel with friendly service there is a much better place up the street on Elliot.  However, if you want an Einstein's copy with Darth Vader behind the counter, come to The Nosh.

L8qLuXQXj6pvi1SEJCig2Q.text: Great breakfast place! After years of driving by im so glad I stopped in - had a great selection and was packed. All the workers were friendly and efficient and the bagels were fantastic! Will definitely be going again soon :)

ZA2Z8RmF9-wtMIYm3boRhw.text: Tough critic from the East Coast but this was a great spot for a delicious bagel or bagel sandwich. Sad im leaving tomorrow or I would go back again. Sesame bagel with honey but cream cheese= heaven.

zmfaEzPNfaL2R74ZxiL5pA.text: Amazing bagels and a great staff. I always get the build your bagel sandwich it's heaven!

skA3eH7XzOyz7uMzjuFZDQ.text: Hello to all you foodies out there!  Been looking for a good Bagel place in the area, because as we all know, bagels are an essential part of life.  We know what the chain bagel places are all about....ok bagels and lousy cream cheese...so I am happy to say Bagel Nosh has some superior cream cheese.  Since this review is about finding a good bagel place, I guess we should start with the bagels.  There is a nice variety of bagels but alas....no egg bagel.  boooooooo  To me, the bagels are similar to the kind you buy in a grocery store bakery area...they are not dense(as I grew up with in Chicago or even New York) but almost fluffier, but they are still good.  So much for the bagels...let get to the cream cheese!    The cream cheese is creamy and thick but not too thick and very flavorful.  When enjoying their bagel and cream cheese sandwich it is safe to say it is the cream cheese that you notice.  I will continue to search for the type bagel I enjoy and in the meantime I will continue to enjoy Bagel Nosh.  I would also like to mention the service is great and the employees are wonderful and very friendly and that alone will bring me back!  Keep up the good work.  I think you should check this place out and in the meantime....  Bon Appetite'

33H3zfXi-5reZp305pO6wQ.text: So far just had the bagels but they were great.  I like the atmosphere inside the shop, too, and the outside seating.

gihf_CJTosI3FezcNoFK3Q.text: Have dropped by here on the way to work a couple of times now.  Staff is super friendly and quick.  Bagels are soft and chewy. I am a super fan of the Nosh Veggie on sesame.  Hoping to have the time to get to sit and have breakfast their soon and try some of the yummy food I have seen.

lY-8XxAst2rDjIuJj1DY8Q.text: Great place for a simple bagel and cream cheese or yummy lunch sandwich! Great food!

tLna_OC37nlDZ287Dv4jQg.text: Not familiar with the area and found on yelp.  So glad! A great breakfast, fresh, good quality, large portions! A friendly staff helpful in my egg whites no meat choice. Lots of variety of bagels baked fresh daily! A delish way to start our day!

MUM5yP6GRt_PyO6kXrB3mA.text: Super friendly staff, relaxed atmosphere and great food. A little pricy, but you definitely get what you pay for.

oTpsCVsbz0hQHG7-GbQvZA.text: My standards are pretty low while extremely hung over wearing the same clothes I participated in crazy drunken debauchery the night before. But I still left Bagel Nosh feeling like I wished I had gone to IHOP next door.  I ordered the $7 Arizona Classic: an egg sandwich with bacon and cheese on the bagel of my choice. The quality was pretty much on par with a McBagel McSandwich but was twice the price. The bacon was more like bacon bits and the egg was thin and tasteless. There was nothing wrong with the service, but the prices were way too high for what I was eating.  My friends had ordered a bagel with spread that looked better. So I guess the rule of thumb here would be to order a bagel only. I would definitely leave other breakfast food concoctions to another restaurant.

IrNLBhWJX3YcUJyAGI-Vzg.text: I've heard way good stuff about this place for a while and finally had the pleasure of sitting down and having some lunch there.  Thoughts: Staff was friendly and quick, nice place, very clean and some hi-tops and lots of tables and outdoor seating as well.  Chicken salad bagel sandwich wasn't too bad at all, except for the nuts in it - I'd probably eat it again however.  Had a tomato basil bagel toasted with it... yum!  I'm wanting to go back to try different menu items now :)

cKPYmv2cD5zK09yxrbFYzg.text: For a bagel shop in the desert, it doesn't get much better.  Great selection of fresh bagels (I love the Salt w/ lox).    The service is quick and friendly, and the decor has local flavor you wont find at any big chain.  The owners really turned this place around about 4 years ago.  Now it is a thriving local hangout for the active adult in Ahwatukee.  In fact, they attract so many road bikers, a bike shop opened next door last year.

kfcPs8fg5_pSadQIZLaM5A.text: I have been here twice and the food and service is excellent and friendly.  The lox and bagel are amazing and A LOT of food.  I have also had the pancakes which are great.  Definitely recommended.

qatQfD4emfrZqsg1ZOru3g.text: Best bagel place in Ahwatukee!! Blows Einstein's away with a huge cannon, bazooka! Support locally owned business, especially when they're miles ahead of the national chains. An example is their bagel and lox. You get a generous bagel with lots of salmon, which is obviously the only reason you'd ever order the lox. To contrast, at Einstein you get a tiny amount of salmon that, honestly, they should be completely embarrassed about serving. The bagels here are incredible too and they offer a nice selection of breakfast and lunch. Oh, and they have great coffee!!!

yhv7JZtQFoGc-0SWlo-cZw.text: There are not many places in the Valley you can find a salt bagel and they have awesome salt bagels, just don't get there too late you won't get one.  The staff is always friendly and when my friends and I come back from our bike rides they always get our food to us quickly.

jfRMo_ketofS3NQqU14SGw.text: The breakfast burrito never disappoints and the kids love the pancakes. Nice selection of coffee and bagels keeps everyone in the family satisfied. A little pricey but the food quality is good. For Ahwatukee it's probably 5 stars but sine there are better places around Phoenix its a 4. They should expand into a bigger space as this places gets crowded in a hurry.

-ByqLCAiGsuABEa_UMbWGQ.text: Love this place!  Sunday was our first time there and we had breakfast.  I ate the French Toast, my wife had the pancakes,Hash Browns and Eggs.  The butter was very good with some flavoring to it.  I'm not sure what it was but we loved it.  Pancakes and French Toast were soft and the hash browns were freshly made to perfection.  Plus they had Kona Coffee!  My toddler even loved the hash browns and pancakes.   I think we found our new Sunday Breakfast spot.
